tricae: <entryFree id="n49013" type="main" key="tri_cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>, orig. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, like Apina, the name of a small town in Apulia; but cf. Sanscr. trkvan, thief; and Lat. tricor, extricare, etc.; hence, prov.</etym>, <sense id="n49013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nonsense.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49013.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt apinae tricaeque et siquid vilius istis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Gri.</hi> Quid dare velis? Eloquere propere. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Nummos trecentos. <hi rend="ital">Gri.</hi> Tricas. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Quadringentos. <hi rend="ital">Gri.</hi> Tramas putridas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49013.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hinderances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterfuges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quirks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tricks</hi>: judicia, lites, turbas, tricas, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo illa (Tullia) fert publicam cladem, quomodo domesticas tricas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi opus est litibus neque tricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tu mihi tricas narras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu istas mittis tricas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 29</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 2</bibl>; cf.: trico, tricor, and tricosus.</sense></entryFree>
tricameratus: <entryFree id="n49014" type="main" key="tri^ca^me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcămĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-camera</etym>, <sense id="n49014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three chambers</hi> (late Lat.). ecclesia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 26: inferiora ar <pb n="1898" /> <cb n="TRIC" /> cae bicamerata et tricamerata facies, Ambros. Hexaëm. 6, 9, n. 72.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcă-mĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a room divided into three chambers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricca: <entryFree id="n49015" type="main" key="Tricca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tricca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Triccē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tri/kkh,</foreign> <sense id="n49015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Peneus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Trikala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 824" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 824</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Triccaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tricca</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricenarius: <entryFree id="n49016" type="main" key="tri_ce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triceni</etym>, <sense id="n49016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing thirty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>thirty quarterdigits in diameter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:48" default="NO">48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <trans><tr>thirty years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Controv. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Excerpt. Controv. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:48" default="NO">48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triceni: <entryFree id="n49017" type="main" key="tri_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n49017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> tricenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 33, 39, § 113</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [triginta], <hi rend="ital">thirty at a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirty each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricenos milites ex singulis legionibus, Auct. B. Afr. 75, 5: dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bini dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latent tricenis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49017.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thirty</hi> cardinally: <cit><quote lang="la">medica ab uno satu tricenis annis durat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(inplent) anguillae in Gange amne tricenos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 44, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> tricenūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 19, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 33, 38, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 49" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricennalis: <entryFree id="n49018" type="main" key="tri_cenna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcennālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tricennium</etym>, <sense id="n49018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to thirty years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tricennial</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incuria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> in Hier. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcennālia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated once in thirty years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tricennial festival</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tricennium: <entryFree id="n49019" type="main" key="tri_cenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>triginta-annos</etym>, <sense id="n49019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space of thirty years</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricenti: <entryFree id="n49020" type="main" key="tri^centi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcenti</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, v. trecenti.</entryFree>
tricenties: <entryFree id="n49021" type="main" key="tri^centi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcentĭes</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. trecenties.</entryFree>
triceps: <entryFree id="n49022" type="main" key="tri_ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-caput; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n49022.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">having three heads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-headed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecate (because she was also at the same time Luna and Diana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 194</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n49022.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=148" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 148</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tricesimani: <entryFree id="n49023" type="main" key="tri_ce_si^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcēsĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tricesimus</etym>, <sense id="n49023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the thirtieth legion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricesimus: <entryFree id="n49024" type="main" key="tri_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcēsĭmus</orth> (less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgēsĭmus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:103:7" default="NO">10, 103, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15</bibl>), a, um, <sense id="n49024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [triginta], <hi rend="ital">the thirtieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem tricesimo post die feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertius et tricesimus annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexto tricesimo anno post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: legio quinta tricesima, Galb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricesimo sexto anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricesimum annum agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricesimo die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricesima sabbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis trigesimus consul instat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīcēsĭmae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a town in</hi> Gallia Belgica <hi rend="ital">on the Rhine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricessis: <entryFree id="n49025" type="hapax" key="tri_cessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcessis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>triginta - as</etym>, <sense id="n49025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirty</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=170" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 170</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
trichalcon: <entryFree id="n49026" type="greek" key="tri^chalcon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchalcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/xalkon,</foreign> <sense id="n49026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coin of the value of three</hi> chalci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
trichaptum: <entryFree id="n49027" type="greek" key="tri^chaptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchaptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/xapton,</foreign> <sense id="n49027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft garment woven of hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hairgarment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Zach. 3, 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Ezech. 4, 16, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichias: <entryFree id="n49028" type="greek" key="tri^chi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trixi/as,</foreign> <sense id="n49028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sardine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichiasis: <entryFree id="n49029" type="greek" key="tri^chi^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trixi/asis,</foreign> <sense id="n49029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the eyelids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the lashes grow inside</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichila: <entryFree id="n49030" type="main" key="tri^chi^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summer-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 7</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 378; 10, 394; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4517</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl> (al. triclinia).—Also, in a contr. collat. form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2909</bibl>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-clĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4337</bibl>; and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭclĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4456.dagger</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/xinos</foreign> (of hair; transf.), <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>: quaestus (opp. uber), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichitis: <entryFree id="n49031" type="greek" key="tri^chi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trixi=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n49031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichomanes: <entryFree id="n49032" type="greek" key="tri^cho^ma^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchŏmănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trixomane/s,</foreign> <sense id="n49032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant resembling</hi> adiantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 111, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 21, 30, § 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichordis: <entryFree id="n49033" type="greek" key="tri^chordis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchordis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/xordos,</foreign> <cb n="TRIC" /> <sense id="n49033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three-stringed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichorum: <entryFree id="n49034" type="greek" key="tri^cho_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭchōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/xwron,</foreign> <sense id="n49034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a room divided into three apartments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pesc. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1595</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trichrus: <entryFree id="n49035" type="greek" key="trichrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trichrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/xrous,</foreign> <sense id="n49035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tricolored gem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricies: <entryFree id="n49036" type="main" key="tri_ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcĭes</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trīcĭens</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcĕsĭes</orth>, Auct. B. Afr. 97, 2 twice: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgĭes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 737</bibl>), <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>triginta</etym>, <sense id="n49036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirty times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pedes) tricies triceni fiunt nongenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: tricies centenis millibus pondo olei eos multat, Auct. B. Afr. 97, 3: mea (filia) triciens (aeris millies) non posset (habere), i. e. <hi rend="ital">three millions of</hi> sesterces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl>; id. Fragm. Fontei. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:37:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:40:1" default="NO">5, 40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricinium: <entryFree id="n49037" type="hapax" key="tri^ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tres-cano</etym>, <sense id="n49037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song by three voices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trio</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semivolucrum puellarum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the three Sirens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tricipitinus: <entryFree id="n49038" type="main" key="Tri^ci^pi^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭcĭpĭtīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Lucretia; e. g. </sense><sense id="n49038.1" n="I" level="1"> Sp. Lucretius Tricipitinus, <hi rend="ital">father of Lucretia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49038.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Lucretius Tricipitinus, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and conqueror of the Volsci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl>; Fast. Capit. ap. Grut. 289. — </sense><sense id="n49038.3" n="III" level="1"> Hostus Lucretius Tricipitinus, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricla: <entryFree id="n49039" type="gloss" key="tri^cla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcla</orth>, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭclĕa</orth>, and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭclĭa</orth>, v. trichila.</entryFree>
tricliniarches: <entryFree id="n49040" type="greek" key="tri_cli_ni^arches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīclīnĭarches</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triklinia/rxhs,</foreign> <sense id="n49040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief servant who has charge of the table</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 794</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2952</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricliniaris: <entryFree id="n49041" type="main" key="tri_cli_ni^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīclīnĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triclinium</etym>, <sense id="n49041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an eating - couch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diningroom.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49041.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 32</bibl></cit> Müll.: apothecae, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 545, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 9, § 47</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:5:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 5, 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49041.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīclīnĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n49041.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An eating-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dining-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supper-room</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49041.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tapestry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covering for table-couches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triclinium: <entryFree id="n49042" type="greek" key="tri_cli_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīclīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trikli/nion,</foreign> <sense id="n49042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a couch running round three sides of a table for reclining on at meals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an eating-couch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">table-couch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49042.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinio posito cenabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:13:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 9, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">habueris quinquaginta tricliniorum lectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triclinio, quod in foro straverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>, § 61; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl> and 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 52, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:3 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49042.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a room for eating in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dining - room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supper - room</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna et aestiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 29</bibl></cit> Müll.; Libo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 507</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trico: <entryFree id="n49043" type="main" key="tri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tricae, II.</etym>, <sense id="n49043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mischiefmaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shuffler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 46</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricoccum: <entryFree id="n49044" type="greek" key="tri^coccum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcoccum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/kokkon</foreign> (that has three berries), <sense id="n49044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> heliotropium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricolum: <entryFree id="n49045" type="greek" key="tri^co_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcōlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/kwlon</foreign> (having three members), <sense id="n49045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sentence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">period consisting of three clauses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:12:section=12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 12, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:4:25:section=27" default="NO">4, 25, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricor: <entryFree id="n49046" type="main" key="tri_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n49046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [tricae], <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">start difficulties; to trifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shuffle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play tricks</hi> (Ciceron.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publilius tecum tricatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 19, 4</bibl></cit>. —Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīco</orth>, reflex., <hi rend="ital">to dally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora surgendi ne te trices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 32, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tricorii: <entryFree id="n49047" type="main" key="Tricori^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tricorĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricorniger: <entryFree id="n49048" type="hapax" key="tri^corni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-cornĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres</etym>, <sense id="n49048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three horns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">points</hi>: species furcae, of the letter <foreign lang="greek">*y,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 13</bibl> technop. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Monos. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tricornis: <entryFree id="n49049" type="main" key="tri^cornis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcornis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-cornu</etym>, <sense id="n49049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three horns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-horned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricorpor: <entryFree id="n49050" type="main" key="tri^corpor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcorpor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-corpus</etym>, <sense id="n49050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-bodied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tricorporal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Geryon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 289</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Geryon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:422" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 422</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:201" default="NO">13, 201</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricosus: <entryFree id="n49051" type="main" key="tri_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tricae</etym>, <sense id="n49051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of difficulties</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perplexities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of wiles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tricks</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 79, 26</bibl> (al. strigosus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 50, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricuspis: <entryFree id="n49052" type="main" key="tri^cuspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-cuspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres</etym>, <sense id="n49052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three</hi> <cb n="TRIE" /> <hi rend="ital">points</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-tineà</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tricuspid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum, i. e. tridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 330</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tridacna: <entryFree id="n49053" type="greek" key="tri^dacna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭdacna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/dakna,</foreign> <sense id="n49053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of oysters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tridens: <entryFree id="n49054" type="main" key="tri^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-dens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> tridenti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:53" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 53</bibl>: <sense id="n49054.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tridente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 283</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 51</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres</etym>, <hi rend="ital">having three teeth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-tined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threepronged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tridented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trident.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49054.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:688" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tridenti armatus ferro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49054.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a three-tined spear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trident</hi>, used to spear large fish, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 15, 20, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:84" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 29, 45, § 84</bibl>.—As an attribute of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 610</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26</bibl> (3, 22), 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 283</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 75</bibl>.—As a weapon of the net-fighters (retiarii), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tridentifer: <entryFree id="n49055" type="hapax" key="tri^denti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭdentĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tridens-fero</etym>, <sense id="n49055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the trident-bearer</hi>, an epithet of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 595</bibl>; cf. tridentiger.</sense></entryFree>
tridentiger: <entryFree id="n49056" type="hapax" key="tri^denti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭdentĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tridens-gero</etym>, <sense id="n49056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the trident-bearer</hi>, an epithet of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 202</bibl>; cf. tridentifer.</sense></entryFree>
tridentipotens: <entryFree id="n49057" type="hapax" key="tri^denti^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭdentĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tridenspotens</etym>, <sense id="n49057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruling with the trident</hi>, an epithet of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:159" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triduanus: <entryFree id="n49058" type="main" key="tri_du^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīdŭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triduum</etym>, <sense id="n49058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lasting three days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of three days</hi>' <hi rend="ital">continuance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 12, 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triduum: <entryFree id="n49059" type="main" key="tri_du^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīdŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. spatium) [tres-dies], <sense id="n49059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space of three days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three days</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi triduom continuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc hoc triduom solum sinas Esse hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduom servire numquam te sinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidui'st aut tridui Haec sollicitudo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut maneas triduom hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decrevit habendas triduum ferias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tridui viam processisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius respondit, triduo illum, ad summum quatriduo periturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduo intermisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triennia: <entryFree id="n49060" type="main" key="tri^enni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭennĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. sacra) [triennium], <sense id="n49060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated every three years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triennial festival</hi>, = trieterica sacra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triennis: <entryFree id="n49061" type="main" key="tri^ennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-annus</etym>, <sense id="n49061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triennium: <entryFree id="n49062" type="main" key="tri^enni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. spatium) [id.], <sense id="n49062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space of three years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium aut triennium est, cum virtuti nuntium remisisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:2:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 19, 3 al.</sense></entryFree>
triens: <entryFree id="n49063" type="main" key="tri^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tres</etym>, <sense id="n49063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a third part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a third</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n49063.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sciemus, quantum quasi sit in trientis triente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicaminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut triens ex heminā supersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 68, § 133</bibl></cit>.—Of inheritances: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duobus coheredibus esse in triente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredes ex triente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49063.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49063.3" n="A" level="2"> Of coins. </sense><sense id="n49063.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The third part of an</hi> as, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 328</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 10, 7</bibl>; Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 38, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:267" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 267</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49063.5" n="2" level="3"> Under the later emperors, a gold coin, <hi rend="ital">the third part of an</hi> aureus, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n49063.6" n="B" level="2"> As a measure of interest, <hi rend="ital">one third per cent.</hi> monthly, or, in our way of reckoning, <hi rend="ital">four per cent.</hi> yearly: <cit><quote lang="la">usurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49063.7" n="C" level="2"> In square or long measure. </sense><sense id="n49063.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The third of a juger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:2" default="NO">5, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49063.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The third of a foot</hi> in length, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:38" default="NO">38</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n49063.10" n="D" level="2"> In liquid measure, <hi rend="ital">a third of a</hi> sextarius, i. e. <hi rend="ital">four</hi> cyathi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl> (4, 9), 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:107:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 107, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:86:1" default="NO">6, 86, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:88:2" default="NO">9, 88, 2</bibl>; 10, 49, 1.—</sense><sense id="n49063.11" n="E" level="2"> Among mathematicians, <hi rend="ital">the number two</hi> (as a third of six), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49063.12" n="III" level="1"> Trientem tertium ... id significare ait Cincius duas libras pondo et trientem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trientabulum: <entryFree id="n49064" type="main" key="tri^enta_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭentābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>triens</etym>, <sense id="n49064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a portion of public land assigned to creditors in place of a third part of the public debt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trientabulumque is ager, quia pro tertiā parte pecuniae datus erat, appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trientalis: <entryFree id="n49065" type="main" key="tri^enta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that contains a third of a foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1899" /> <cb n="TRIF" /></sense></entryFree>
trientarius: <entryFree id="n49066" type="main" key="tri^enta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triens, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n49066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a third part</hi>: faenus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a third of one per cent.</hi> monthly, or, in our manner, <hi rend="ital">four per cent.</hi> a year, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. P. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trientius: <entryFree id="n49067" type="hapax" key="tri^enti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭentĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triens</etym>, <sense id="n49067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sold for a third</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trierarchus: <entryFree id="n49068" type="greek" key="tri^e_rarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭērarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trih/rarxos,</foreign> <sense id="n49068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the captain of a trireme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trierarch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2652</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3595</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3603</bibl>; 3615 sq.</sense></entryFree>
trieris: <entryFree id="n49069" type="greek" key="tri^e_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭēris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">trih/rhs,</foreign> <sense id="n49069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three ranges of oars.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49069.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: navis, Auct. B. Afr. 44, 2.—</sense><sense id="n49069.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">galley of three ranges of oar-banks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trireme</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3610</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3612</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3617</bibl> sq.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 33, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 11, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trietericus: <entryFree id="n49070" type="greek" key="tri^e^te_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭĕtērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">triethriko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n49070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recurring every three years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triennial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>the festival of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 587</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called trieterica orgia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 302</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭĕtērĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 593</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:661" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 661</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 131" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 131</bibl>; cf. trieteris.</sense></entryFree>
trieteris: <entryFree id="n49071" type="greek" key="tri^e^te_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭĕtēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triethri/s.</foreign> <sense id="n49071.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a space of three years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three years</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:85:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 85, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:53:3" default="NO">10, 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n49071.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a triennial festival;</hi> of the festival of Bacchus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trietericus.—Of the Nemean games,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:722" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 722</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifariam: <entryFree id="n49072" type="main" key="tri^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfārĭam</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfārĭē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 279</bibl> P.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>trifarius</etym>, <sense id="n49072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">triply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in three places</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">trifariam adortus castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muniebant Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distraxere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 41, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas dispertire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49072.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Triply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a threefold manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in three ways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">destruitur propositio trifariam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 32, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trifarius: <entryFree id="n49073" type="main" key="tri^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">trifa/sios</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three sorts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">causa morborum omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 305, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 40 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia numerorum in corporibus trifaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trifaux: <entryFree id="n49074" type="hapax" key="tri^faux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfaux</orth>, <itype>cis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-faux</etym>, <sense id="n49074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three throats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-throated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratus Cerberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 417</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trifax: <entryFree id="n49075" type="main" key="tri^fax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfax</orth>, <itype>fācis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of long missile weapon</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 524 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifer: <entryFree id="n49076" type="main" key="tri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-fero</etym>, <sense id="n49076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thricebearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that bears fruit three times a year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus trifero proventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trifidus: <entryFree id="n49077" type="main" key="tri^fi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-findo</etym>, <sense id="n49077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cloven into three parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threeforked</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hasta (Neptuni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:641" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 641</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis Neptuni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lightning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 325</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ardores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:53" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae Phocaeae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cross-roads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 772" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 772</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Phocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 687" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 687</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">motus linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum prorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:358" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicania,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>triangular</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trifilis: <entryFree id="n49078" type="hapax" key="tri^fi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter - filum</etym>, <sense id="n49078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three threads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:74:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 74, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trifinium: <entryFree id="n49079" type="main" key="tri^fi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter - finis</etym>, <sense id="n49079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where three boundaries meet</hi>, Sicul. Flacc. Condit. Agr. p. 6 Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 201, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 15, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifissilis: <entryFree id="n49080" type="hapax" key="tri^fissi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfissĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter - findo</etym>, = trifidus, <sense id="n49080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cloven into three parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threeforked</hi>: forma <foreign lang="greek">*y,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 128, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifolinus: <entryFree id="n49081" type="main" key="Tri^fo^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭfŏlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n49081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Trifolium near Naples</hi> (which abounded in grape-vines): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:114:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 114, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:212" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifolium: <entryFree id="n49082" type="main" key="tri^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter - folium</etym>, <sense id="n49082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threeleaved grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trefoil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:152" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21, 88, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triformis: <entryFree id="n49083" type="main" key="tri^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter - forma</etym>, <sense id="n49083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three forms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shapes</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">natures; threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triform</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Chimaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cerberus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1202" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geryon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 841" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 841</bibl></cit>: diva, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, who was also Luna and Hecate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 4</bibl>; called also triformis dea, <cb n="TRIG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus, because composed of air, earth, and water,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:859" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 859</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triformitas: <entryFree id="n49084" type="main" key="tri^formi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭformĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>triformis</etym>, <sense id="n49084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">triplicity of shape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifur: <entryFree id="n49085" type="hapax" key="tri^fu_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-fūr</orth>, <itype>fūris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ter</etym>, <sense id="n49085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a triple thief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an arrant thief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fur sed trifur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. trifurcifer.</sense></entryFree>
trifurcifer: <entryFree id="n49086" type="main" key="tri^furci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-furcĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arch rogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrant knave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 29</bibl>; cf. trifur.</sense></entryFree>
trifurcium: <entryFree id="n49087" type="hapax" key="tri^furci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfurcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>trifurcus</etym>, <sense id="n49087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any thing of a three-forked shape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trifurcus: <entryFree id="n49088" type="main" key="tri^furcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭfurcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-furca</etym>, <sense id="n49088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three forks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prongs</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">points</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threeforked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-pronged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 20:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triga: <entryFree id="n49089" type="main" key="tri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from trijuga</etym>. * <sense id="n49089.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A team of three horses</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a chariot drawn by three horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 38, § 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49089.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A set of three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 136</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 439</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trigamia: <entryFree id="n49090" type="greek" key="tri^ga^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trigami/a,</foreign> <sense id="n49090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threefold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">third marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trigamy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jov. 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trigamus: <entryFree id="n49091" type="greek" key="tri^ga^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/gamos,</foreign> <sense id="n49091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thricemarried man</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who has three wives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">who has been married three times</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trigarius: <entryFree id="n49092" type="main" key="tri_ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triga</etym>, <sense id="n49092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> triga; used only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49092.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who drives a threehorse chariot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 72, § 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1, 5, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49092.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n49092.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place in which</hi> trigae (and horses in general) <hi rend="ital">are trained and exercised</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 202</bibl>; cf.: trigarium <foreign lang="greek">to/pos, o(/pou i(/ppoi gumna/zontai,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n49092.4" n="2" level="3"> As a <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">square in Rome in the ninth region</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4266</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49092.5" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to triga, II.) <hi rend="ital">The number three</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 733</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 895</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trigemino: <entryFree id="n49093" type="hapax" key="tri^ge^mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgĕmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>trigeminus</etym>, <sense id="n49093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to triple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
trigeminus: <entryFree id="n49094" type="main" key="tri^ge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgĕmĭnus</orth> (collat. form, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tergĕmĭnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tresgeminus</etym>, <sense id="n49094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three born at a birth</hi>: fratres, <hi rend="ital">three twin-brothers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49094.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tergeminos nasci certum est Horatiorum Curiatiorumque exemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trigeminorum matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trigemini filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 123</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgĕmĭni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">three brothers born at a birth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:7" default="NO">7, 6, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trigemino partu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius trigemina spolia prae se gerens,</quote> <trans><tr>of the three twin-brothers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trigemini,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a comedy of Plautus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49094.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triform</hi>, = triplex (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">trigeminae victoriae triplicem triumphum egistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripectora tergemini vis Geryonai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same and of Cerberus: tergeminumque virum tergeminumque canem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of Cerberus: cui tres sunt linguae tergeminumque caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 52: tergemina Hecate (because she was also Luna and Diana; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">triceps and triformis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergemina dextra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the three Graces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus tergeminae prolis. i. e. trium liberorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomorum tergemina natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba illa Ciceronis in Pisonem (cap. 1) trigemina: decepit, fefellit, induxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 22</bibl></cit>: certat tergeminis tollere honoribus, <hi rend="ital">to the threefold honors</hi>, i. e. of the three highest magistracies, those of the curule ædile, the prætor, and the consul, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tibi tergeminum mugiet ille sophos,</quote> <trans><tr>thrice repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:46:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 46, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49094.3" n="III" level="1"> Porta Trigemina, <hi rend="ital">a gate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the early times of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of Mount Aventine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 157 sq.</sense></entryFree>
trigemmis: <entryFree id="n49095" type="main" key="tri^gemmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgemmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-gemma</etym>, <sense id="n49095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three buds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trigesimus: <entryFree id="n49096" type="main" key="tri_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. tricesimus.</entryFree>
triginta: <entryFree id="n49097" type="main" key="tri_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīginta</orth> (freq. written <sense id="n49097.0" n="XXX" level="1">), <hi rend="ital">num. adj. indecl.</hi> [<foreign lang="greek">tria/konta</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">thirty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus cum septem et triginta regnavisset annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta magnos orbīs explebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 269</bibl></cit>: conjectus in carcerem triginta jussu tyrannorum,<cb n="TRIM" />  <hi rend="ital">of the thirty tyrants</hi> (in Athens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28, 44</bibl> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
triglitis: <entryFree id="n49098" type="greek" key="trigli_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triglītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trigli=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n49098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triglyphus: <entryFree id="n49099" type="greek" key="tri_gly^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīglyphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/glufos;</foreign> in archit., <sense id="n49099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament in the frieze of the Doric order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triglyph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
trigon: <entryFree id="n49100" type="greek" key="tri^go_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/gwn</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">tri/gwnon,</foreign> <sense id="n49100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ball for playing with</hi>, esp. in the baths, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:9" default="NO">7, 72, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:83:3" default="NO">12, 83, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugio campum lusumque trigonem,</quote> <trans><tr>a game of ball</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trigonalis: <entryFree id="n49101" type="hapax" key="tri^go_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trigon</etym>, <sense id="n49101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> trigon: <cit><quote lang="la">pila, i. e. trigon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:46" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
trigonicus: <entryFree id="n49102" type="greek" key="tri^go_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">trigwniko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n49102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">triangular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trigonal</hi>: radiatio, Firm. Math. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 4 praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
