trigonium: <entryFree id="n49103" type="greek" key="tri^go_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/gwnon.</foreign> <sense id="n49103.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A triangle</hi>, Innoc. Cas. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 224 Goes.— </sense><sense id="n49103.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of two plants</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trigonus: <entryFree id="n49104" type="greek" key="tri^go_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/gwnos,</foreign> <sense id="n49104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triangular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trigonal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49104.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 342</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n49104.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49104.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgō-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/gwnon,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a triangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trigon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:4:95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 4, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> — <cit><quote lang="la">Scanned trĭgŏna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 50</bibl></cit>; Ecl. Rat. Puerper. 39.—</sense><sense id="n49104.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭgōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <cit><quote lang="la">med. t. t.,</quote> <trans><tr>a soothing pill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:104" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49105" type="main" key="tri_go^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīgŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sting-ray</hi>: Raia pastinaca, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 71</bibl> (Fleckeis, trugonum).</sense></entryFree>
trihorium: <entryFree id="n49106" type="main" key="tri^ho_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭhōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tres-hora</etym>, <sense id="n49106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space of three hours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three hours</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trijugis: <entryFree id="n49107" type="hapax" key="tri^ju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭjŭgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-jugum</etym>, <sense id="n49107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawn by three horses yoked abreast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-horse-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cisium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trijugus: <entryFree id="n49108" type="main" key="tri^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-jugum, tripleyoked; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n49108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trilaterus: <entryFree id="n49109" type="hapax" key="tri^la^te^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭlătĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-latus</etym>, <sense id="n49109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three-sided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trilateral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 35" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 35</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
trilibris: <entryFree id="n49110" type="main" key="tri^li_bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭlībris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-libra</etym>, <sense id="n49110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three pounds weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-pound-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: paterae, scyphi, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trilinguis: <entryFree id="n49111" type="main" key="tri^linguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭlinguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-lingua</etym>. <sense id="n49111.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">triple-tongued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having three tongues</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ōs (Cerberi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus (Hecates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:184" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla (i. e. serpentis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 150</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49111.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Speaking three tongues</hi> or <hi rend="ital">languages</hi>: Massilienses (who spoke Greek, Latin, and Gallic), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculi (because they spoke Greek, Punic, and Latin),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Hebraeus, Graecus, Latinus: trilinguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trilix: <entryFree id="n49112" type="main" key="tri^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭlix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>nom.</case> trilicis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 22, 23</bibl>) [ter-licium], <sense id="n49112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woven with three sets of leashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-twilled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:143:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 143, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 467</bibl></cit> (trino nexu intexta, Serv.): <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:199" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trilongus: <entryFree id="n49113" type="hapax" key="tri^longus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-longus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter</etym>, <sense id="n49113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of three long syllables</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2413" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2413</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
triloris: <entryFree id="n49114" type="hapax" key="tri^lo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭlōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-lorum</etym>, <sense id="n49114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three stripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-striped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trimatus: <entryFree id="n49115" type="main" key="tri_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>trimus</etym>, <sense id="n49115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of three years</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (gallinae) trimatum excesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a trimatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in trimatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 20, 22, § 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4713</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trimembris: <entryFree id="n49116" type="hapax" key="tri^membris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmembris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-membrum</etym>, <sense id="n49116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three sets of limbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-membered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geryon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trimestris: <entryFree id="n49117" type="main" key="tri^mestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-mensis</etym>, <sense id="n49117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three months.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49117.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedi,</quote> <trans><tr>three months old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni Arcadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that ripens in three months</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 69</bibl></cit>: aves, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that remain with us but three months</hi>, <pb n="1900" /> <cb n="TRIN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 25, 36, § 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum caelique vices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. 11, 24</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49117.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭme-strĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">seeds that ripen three months after sowing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:20" default="NO">11, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 240</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trimetros: <entryFree id="n49118" type="greek" key="tri^me^tro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmĕtrŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-trus</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype> (postclass. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmĕtrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 78</bibl>; Sid. poët. Ep. 9, 15), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/metros;</foreign> in prosody, <sense id="n49118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing three metres</hi> or <hi rend="ital">double-feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trimeter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmē^tros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-trus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a trimeter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:75" default="NO">9, 4, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:108 al" default="NO">9, 4, 108 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2432" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2432</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 506</bibl> ib.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmĕ-ter</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trimodia: <entryFree id="n49119" type="main" key="tri^mo^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmŏdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭmŏ-dĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 20</bibl>) [tres-modius], <sense id="n49119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel that contains three</hi> modii, <hi rend="ital">a three-peck measure</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO">12, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:8" default="NO">12, 52, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trimontium: <entryFree id="n49120" type="main" key="Tri^monti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭmontĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a later name of the city Philippopolis in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trimulus: <entryFree id="n49121" type="main" key="tri_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [trimus], <hi rend="ital">of three years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trimulus patrem amisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nepotem amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Verr. 9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Verr. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trimus: <entryFree id="n49122" type="main" key="tri_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres</etym>, <sense id="n49122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia, trima quae periit mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumne in pulvere, trimus, Quale prius ludas opus,</quote> <trans><tr>when a child of three years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccae aetatis trimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 24, 54, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl></cit>.—In law: dies, <hi rend="ital">a term of three years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita sit legatum, heres meus Titio decem trimā die dato, utrum pensionibus an vero post triennium debeatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:3:section=5 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 3, § 5 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. prooem.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: melius post trimum domatur equulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capri ante trimos minus utiliter generant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trinacria: <entryFree id="n49123" type="main" key="Tri_na_^cri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīnā^crĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trinakri/a</foreign> (with three promontories), <sense id="n49123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the island of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 582</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49123.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīnā^-crĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Trinacrian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicitian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pachynus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 554</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Trinacria rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:287" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 573</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49123.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīnā^cris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trinacrian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: terra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Trinacria</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:420" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 420</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Trinacris insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hybla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīnăcris</orth> (sc. insula), <hi rend="ital">the island of Trinacria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinalis: <entryFree id="n49124" type="main" key="tri_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trini</etym>, <sense id="n49124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three</hi> (late Lat.), Adaman. Vit. Columb. 3, 22.</sense></entryFree>
trinepos: <entryFree id="n49125" type="main" key="tri^ne^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnĕpos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ter-nepos</etym>, <sense id="n49125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grandson in the fifth degree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO">38, 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trineptis: <entryFree id="n49126" type="main" key="tri^neptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭneptis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ter-neptis</etym>, <sense id="n49126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female descendant in the fifth degree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO">38, 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trini: <entryFree id="n49127" type="main" key="tri_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">terni</orth>), <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n49127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [tres], <hi rend="ital">three each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse cum tribus legionibus circum Samorabrivam trinis hibernis hiemare constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trina sacrificia in die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 67</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n49127.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>, = triplex: <cit><quote lang="la">trinis catenis vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidia, Auct. B. Alex. 37, 3: soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 31, 31, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:216" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trina bella civilia, plura externa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles Vitellianus trinis et ipse praesidiis occurrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita (Cerberi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 783" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 783</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49127.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus trino conficitur versu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 35, 52, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trino relicto praesidio, Auct. B. Afr. 80, 2: forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus interdictorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49127.4" n="2" level="3"> Mostly in phrase, trinum nundinum, <hi rend="ital">the time of three</hi> nundinae or <hi rend="ital">market-days;</hi> v. nundinus, III.—By the lex Caecilia et Didia, B. C. 98, that a promulgatio trinum nundinum, or a putting up in public for at least seventeen days, should be <cb n="TRIP" /> made of any proposed law before taking a vote on it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 16, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinio: <entryFree id="n49128" type="main" key="tri_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trey</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinitas: <entryFree id="n49129" type="main" key="tri_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trini</etym>, <sense id="n49129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triad</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n49129.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">facta exinde trinitas generum est ex trinitate causarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49129.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the Trinity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinobantes: <entryFree id="n49130" type="main" key="Trino^bantes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trinŏbantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the eastern part of Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Essex and the southern parts of Suffolk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinoctialis: <entryFree id="n49131" type="hapax" key="tri^nocti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnoctĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trinoctium</etym>, <sense id="n49131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three nights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the space of three nights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trinoctial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domicenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:77:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 77, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trinoctium: <entryFree id="n49132" type="main" key="tri^nocti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnoctĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter-nox</etym>, <sense id="n49132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space of three nights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three nights</hi>: continuum, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinodis: <entryFree id="n49133" type="main" key="tri^no_dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnōdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-nodus</etym>, <sense id="n49133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three knots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-knotted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49133.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">clava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:575" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 575</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n49133.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dactylus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of three syllables</tr>, <tr>trisyllabic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trinominis: <entryFree id="n49134" type="main" key="tri^no_mi^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnōmĭnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-nomen</etym>, <sense id="n49134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three names</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-named</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hierosolyma (Jebus, Salem, Jerusalem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trinso: <entryFree id="n49135" type="main" key="trinso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trinso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. trisso.</entryFree>
trinummus: <entryFree id="n49136" type="main" key="Tri^nummus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭnummus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Trĭnūmus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy by Plautus;</hi> cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinundinus: <entryFree id="n49137" type="main" key="tri^nundi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnundĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres nundinae</etym>, <sense id="n49137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to three weekly market-days</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">trinundino die,</quote> <trans><tr>after seventeen days</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 34</bibl></cit>; v. trinus, II. B., and nundinus, III. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭnundĭnō</orth>, = trinundino die, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trinus: <entryFree id="n49138" type="main" key="tri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. trini, II. B.</entryFree>
trio: <entryFree id="n49139" type="main" key="tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Triones.</entryFree>
triobolus: <entryFree id="n49140" type="greek" key="tri^o_bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭōbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triw/bolos.</foreign> <sense id="n49140.0" n="I" level="1"> As a coin, <hi rend="ital">a piece of three</hi> oboli, <hi rend="ital">a half-drachm;</hi> used to denote <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negare se debere tibi triobolum,</quote> <trans><tr>a sixpence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque triobolum ullum amicae das,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 67</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego homo trioboli sum, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 168</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49140.1" n="II" level="1"> As a weight, <hi rend="ital">half a drachm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 127, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triocala: <entryFree id="n49141" type="main" key="Tri^o_ca^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭōcăla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*triw/kala,</foreign> <sense id="n49141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain-fortress in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Selinus and Heraclea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">ruins near Calatabellotta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:270" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 270</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭōcălī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Triocala</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Triocalino (sc. agro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭōcălīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Triocala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14</bibl>. § 91.</sense></entryFree>
triones: <entryFree id="n49142" type="main" key="Tri^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (orig. the ploughingoxen; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=74 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 74 sq.</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 7</bibl>; hence, transf.), <sense id="n49142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Wain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ursa Major and Ursa Minor</hi> (which were compared to a wagon with oxen yoked to it): <cit><quote lang="la">Arcturum pluviasque Hyadas geminosque Triones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyperborei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:46:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 46, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Odrysii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:80:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inoccidui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gigantom. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 446</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trionymus: <entryFree id="n49143" type="greek" key="tri^o_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭōnymus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">triw/numos,</foreign> <sense id="n49143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three names</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple-named</hi>, = trinominis: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina propria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 580</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">unio solitarii dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triopas: <entryFree id="n49144" type="main" key="Tri^o^pas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭŏpas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trio/pas,</foreign> <sense id="n49144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Erisichthon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49144.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭŏpēïus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Triopas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Erisichthon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 751</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49144.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭŏpēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a granddaughter of Triopas and daughter of Erisichthon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Mestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 872</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triophthalmos: <entryFree id="n49145" type="greek" key="tri^ophthalmo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭophthalmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trio/fqalmos</foreign> (three-eyed), <sense id="n49145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 71, § 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triorches: <entryFree id="n49146" type="greek" key="tri^orches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭorches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trio/rxhs</foreign> (having three testicles), <sense id="n49146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of falcon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the buzzard</hi>: Falco buteo, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:204" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 74, 95, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triorchis: <entryFree id="n49147" type="greek" key="triorchis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triorchis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triorxi/s,</foreign> <sense id="n49147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of centaury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 32, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tripalis: <entryFree id="n49148" type="hapax" key="tri^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-palus</etym>, <sense id="n49148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has</hi>, <cb n="TRIP" /> or <hi rend="ital">is propped up by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three stakes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pales</hi>: vineae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triparcus: <entryFree id="n49149" type="hapax" key="tri^parcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-parcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter</etym>, <sense id="n49149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stingy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">niggardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripartitio: <entryFree id="n49150" type="main" key="tri^parti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpartītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tripartitus</etym>, <sense id="n49150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threefold division</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 4.</sense></entryFree>
tripartito: <entryFree id="n49151" type="main" key="tri^parti_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpartītō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-pertītō</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tripartitus <sense id="n49151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tripartitus: <entryFree id="n49152" type="main" key="tri^parti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpartītus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-pertītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ter-partior], <sense id="n49152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divided</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divisible into three parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tripartite</hi> (rare, but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ea causa tripertita erit in accusatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tripertitas orbis terrarum oras atque regiones notavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:61:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 61, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripartita ab iis inducitur ratio bonorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio tripartita (al. tripertita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus privatum, quod tripartitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Substt</hi> </sense><sense id="n49152.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭpertīta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a treatise by</hi> Sex. Aelius: <cit><quote lang="la">exstat illius (Sex. Aelii) liber, qui inscribitur Tripertita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49152.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭpertīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy by Novius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpartītō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-pertītō</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into three parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bona dividit tripertito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripartito divisus equitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar partitis copiis ... adit tripartito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggreditur urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripatinum: <entryFree id="n49153" type="hapax" key="tri^pa^ti^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpătĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter-patina</etym>, <sense id="n49153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a service of three dishes</hi>, Fenest. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tripectorus: <entryFree id="n49154" type="hapax" key="tri^pecto^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpectŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-pectus</etym>, <sense id="n49154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three breasts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-breasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triplebreasted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis Geryonaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripedalis: <entryFree id="n49155" type="main" key="tri^pe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-pĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter</etym>, <sense id="n49155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three feet</hi> in measure: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo fenestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassitudo parietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 79, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripedaneus: <entryFree id="n49156" type="main" key="tri^pe^da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-pĕdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three feet</hi> in measure, <hi rend="ital">three-foot-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripertito: <entryFree id="n49157" type="main" key="tri^perti_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpertītō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tripartito.</entryFree>
tripertitus: <entryFree id="n49158" type="main" key="tri^perti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpertītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. tripartitus.</entryFree>
tripes: <entryFree id="n49159" type="main" key="tri^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter</etym>, <sense id="n49159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grabatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulus natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 45, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of a man leaning on a staff</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> 1, 219</bibl>, de sene.</sense></entryFree>
tripetia: <entryFree id="n49160" type="hapax" key="tri^pe^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tripes</etym>, <sense id="n49160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a three-legged stool</hi> among the Gallic peasantry, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triphallus: <entryFree id="n49161" type="greek" key="Tri^phallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭphallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tri/fallos</foreign> (with a great phallus), <sense id="n49161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Priapus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 83, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triphylia: <entryFree id="n49162" type="main" key="Tri^phy_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭphȳlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of the southern portion of Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 34</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭphȳlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Triphylian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jupiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripictus: <entryFree id="n49163" type="hapax" key="tri^pictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [ter-pingo], <sense id="n49163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">written three times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versiculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 381</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triplaris: <entryFree id="n49164" type="main" key="tri^pla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triplus</etym>, <sense id="n49164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
triplasius: <entryFree id="n49165" type="greek" key="tripla^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triplăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tripla/sios,</foreign> <sense id="n49165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 954</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triplex: <entryFree id="n49166" type="main" key="tri_^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trī^plex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> regularly triplici; <sense id="n49166.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">triplice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 383</bibl></cit>; Ven. Carm. 7, 4, 12), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-plico</etym>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49166.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato triplicem finxit animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophandi ratio triplex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: nec me pastoris Iberi Forma triplex, nec forma triplex tua, Cerbere, movit, Ov M. 9, 185: cuspis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Neptune</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s trident</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 594</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus (because made up of sky, land, and sea),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum (because shared among Jupiter, Neptune, and Pluto),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 368</bibl></cit>: vultus Dianae (because also Luna and Hecate; <cit><quote lang="la">v. triceps and triformis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 79</bibl></cit>: triplicem aciem instruere, <hi rend="ital">to draw up an army in three lines</hi> or <hi rend="ital">columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to form a triple line</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 83 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comically: paravi copias duplices, triplices dolos. perfidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallus, Auct. B. Alex. 2, 3: murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 549</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:801" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 801</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 784</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplici stant ordine dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 34</bibl></cit> et saep. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of three like persons or things belonging together: triplices Sorores,<pb n="1901" /> <cb n="TRIP" />  <hi rend="ital">the three sisters</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Fates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 452</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called triplices deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:654" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 654</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ratum triplici pollice netis opus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the finger of the three Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 76</bibl></cit>: poenarum deae triplices, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Furies</hi>, id. M, 8, 481: <cit><quote lang="la">Minyeïdes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the three daughters of Minyas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:425" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <trans><tr>three bands of Bacchantes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 24; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans><tr>three clans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 202</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49166.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49166.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trī^plex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">three times as much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a threefold portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>: sume tibi decies; tibi tantundem; <cit><quote lang="la">tibi triplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2</bibl></cit> 3, 237; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pediti in singulos dati centeni (denarii), duplex centurioni, triplex equiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 43, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei veteris triplex adicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 218" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 218</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49166.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trī^plĭces</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. codicilli), <hi rend="ital">a writing-tablet with three leaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 72, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:6" default="NO">10, 87, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:6:1" default="NO">14, 6, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n49166.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>: triplici fluctu, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 116</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl> Dietsch). — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplĭcĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a threefold manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in three ways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 42, 54</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">l</hi> littera tripliciter sonat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triplicabilis: <entryFree id="n49167" type="main" key="tri^pli^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triplico</etym>, <sense id="n49167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be tripled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod simplex, triplicet: quodque est triplicabile, simplet, of the Trinity,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 281</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triplicatio: <entryFree id="n49168" type="main" key="tri^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.), <sense id="n49168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tripling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trebling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triplication.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49168.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 750</bibl>; Firm. Math. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.— </sense><sense id="n49168.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a surrejoinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triplication</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:10:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tripliciter: <entryFree id="n49169" type="main" key="tri^pli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. triplex <sense id="n49169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
triplico: <entryFree id="n49170" type="main" key="tri_^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trī^plĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>triplex</etym>, <sense id="n49170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to multiply by three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to treble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id triplicatum corvis (tribuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 21, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triplinthius: <entryFree id="n49171" type="greek" key="tri^plinthi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplinthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tripli/nqios,</foreign> <sense id="n49171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three bricks thick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triplus: <entryFree id="n49172" type="greek" key="tri^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. num.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">triplou=s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplo plus scortorum,</quote> <trans><tr>three times as many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripodatio: <entryFree id="n49173" type="gloss" key="tri^po^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŏdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>‡ tripodo</etym>, <sense id="n49173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measured stamping with the feet</hi> of the Arval brothers, Inscr. Frat. Arv. Orell. 2271; cf. <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŭdĭātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">xorei/a i(ere/ws peri\ to\n bwmo/n,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
tripodes: <entryFree id="n49174" type="main" key="tri^po^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŏdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. tripus.</entryFree>
tripodius: <entryFree id="n49175" type="hapax" key="tri^po^dius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŏdius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tripo/dios,</foreign> <sense id="n49175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of three feet</hi>: pes, <hi rend="ital">a metrical foot</hi>, = Bacchius.</sense></entryFree>
tripodo: <entryFree id="n49176" type="gloss" key="tri^po^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŏdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. tripudio.</entryFree>
tripolis: <entryFree id="n49177" type="main" key="Tri^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tri/polis</foreign> (prop. threetown), <sense id="n49177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several districts of country and of towns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49177.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭpŏlĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tripolis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49177.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A country of Africa</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭpŏlĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tripolis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49177.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Phœnicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49177.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district of Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Tegea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">including the cities of Belmina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carystus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Pellene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27, 9</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭpŏlĭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tripolis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tripolium: <entryFree id="n49178" type="greek" key="tri^po^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tripo/lion,</foreign> <sense id="n49178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant growing on cliffs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 22, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triportentum: <entryFree id="n49179" type="hapax" key="tri^portentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-portentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter</etym>, <sense id="n49179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extraordinary omen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portent</hi>: deūm triportenta. Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 59</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 381 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
triporticus: <entryFree id="n49180" type="main" key="Tri^porti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭportĭcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a triple porch</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 2:177:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 2, 177, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triptolemus: <entryFree id="n49181" type="main" key="Tripto^le^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Triptŏlĕmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tripto/lemos,</foreign> <sense id="n49181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Celeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Eleusis and of Metanira; he was the inventor of agriculture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and became a judge in the infernal regions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:507 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 507 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:646 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 646 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 147" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 147</bibl>.—Prov.: Triptolemo fruges dare, like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to carry coals to Newcastle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 10</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Triptŏlĕmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Triptolemus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to husbandry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agricultural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the plough</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. prol. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triptota: <entryFree id="n49182" type="main" key="tripto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triptōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/ptwta,</foreign> <sense id="n49182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nouns</hi> <cb n="TRIS" /> <hi rend="ital">that have only three cases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triptotes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 288</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
tripudiatio: <entryFree id="n49183" type="main" key="tri^pu^di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŭdĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. tripodatio <sense id="n49183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tripudio: <entryFree id="n49184" type="main" key="tri^pu^dio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŭdio</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŏdo</orth>, āre; <sense id="n49184.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tripudium</etym>; in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to beat the ground with the feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dance</hi>, as a relig. exercise (syn.: salio, salto). </sense><sense id="n49184.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">CARMEN DESCINDENTES TRIPODAVERVNT IN VERBA HAEC: ENOS LASES, etc., Inscr. Frat. Arv. Orell. 2271: sacro tripudiare gradu, Ven. Carm. 8, 4, 4: qui in honesto saltatu tripudiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 26, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49184.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilem in modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:32:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad symphoniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris saltibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 29</bibl></cit>: in funeribus rei publicae exsultans et tripudians, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 41, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tripudium: <entryFree id="n49185" type="main" key="tri^pu^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpŭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 72</bibl>, contr. from terripavium, terripudium, but prob. from ter and pes; cf. the old form tripodare, whence tripodatio</etym>; in relig. lang., <sense id="n49185.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a measured stamping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jumping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dancing</hi> in relig. solemnities, <hi rend="ital">a solemn religious dance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salios ancilia ferre ac per urbem ire canentes carmina, cum tripudiis sollemnique saltatu jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. tripudio and ‡ tripodatio.—</sense><sense id="n49185.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a dance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citatis celerare tripudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripudia Hispanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sui moris tripudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus incohantium proelium et ululatus et tripudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49185.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A favorable omen</hi>, when the sacred chickens ate so greedily that the food dropped from their mouths to the ground, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>; cf. solistimus.</sense></entryFree>
tripus: <entryFree id="n49186" type="greek" key="tri^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> tripodi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 739</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/pous,</foreign> <sense id="n49186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a three-footed seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tripod.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49186.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">donarem tripodas, praemia fortium Graiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49186.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49186.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the tripod of Pythia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the priestess of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at Delphi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 360</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 789</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 86" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49186.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49186.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The oracle at Delphi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittitur ad tripodas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:855" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 855</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49186.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An oracle</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">salve, prisca fides tripodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:509" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 509</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:544" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 544</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 785" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 785</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triquetrus: <entryFree id="n49187" type="main" key="tri^que_^trus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭquē^trus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n49187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three corners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-cornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triangular.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49187.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">triquetra aliis, aliis quadrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager (opp. quadratus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura (opp. quadrata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Britannia) insula naturā triquetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martis sidus numquam stationem facere Jovis sidere triquetro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>distant by a third of the zodiac</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl></cit>; also as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭquē^trum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the trinal aspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that in which a planet</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s longitude differs by one-third of a circle from the earth</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triquetro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 18, 16, § 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49187.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the island of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sicilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 717</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:489" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 489</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triremis: <entryFree id="n49188" type="main" key="tri^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-rēmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-remus</etym>, <sense id="n49188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three banks of oars.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49188.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49188.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-rēmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel with three banks of oars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trireme</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:17:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 17, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 207</bibl>,</sense></entryFree>
tris: <entryFree id="n49189" type="main" key="tri_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīs</orth>, v. tres <sense id="n49189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
