trisaeclisenex: <entryFree id="n49190" type="main" key="tri^saecli^se^nex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭsaeclĭsĕnex</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tres-saeculumsenex</etym>, <sense id="n49190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the old man of three generations</hi>, a surname of Nestor, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trischoenus: <entryFree id="n49191" type="greek" key="tri^schoenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭschoenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/sxoinos,</foreign> <sense id="n49191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing three</hi> schoeni: mensura. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triscurrium: <entryFree id="n49192" type="main" key="triscurri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triscurrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter-scurra</etym>, <sense id="n49192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gross buffoonery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 2, 480, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:190" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trisemus: <entryFree id="n49193" type="greek" key="tri^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭsēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/shmos,</foreign> <sense id="n49193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing three syllabic times</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one long and one short syllable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 978</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trismegistus: <entryFree id="n49194" type="main" key="Trisme^gistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trismĕgistus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trisme/gistos</foreign> (thrice-greatest), <sense id="n49194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Mercury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 25, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trispastos: <entryFree id="n49195" type="greek" key="trispastos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trispastos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. machina), = <foreign lang="greek">tri/spastos,</foreign> <sense id="n49195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoisting-tackle with three pulleys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two in the upper and one in the lower block</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trispast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3</bibl>. <cb n="TRIS" /></sense></entryFree>
trispithami: <entryFree id="n49196" type="main" key="Trispi^tha^mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trispĭthămi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trispiqamoi/</foreign> (three spans high), <sense id="n49196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a race of dwarfs beyond India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trissago: <entryFree id="n49197" type="main" key="trissa_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trissāgo</orth>, v. trixago.</entryFree>
trisso: <entryFree id="n49198" type="hapax" key="trisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, of the note of the swallow, <sense id="n49198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twitter</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 26 (al. trinsat).</sense></entryFree>
tristatae: <entryFree id="n49199" type="main" key="Trista^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tristătae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trista/tai,</foreign> <sense id="n49199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the three highest nobles of a country next to the king</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 7, 23, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triste: <entryFree id="n49200" type="main" key="triste^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tristis <sense id="n49200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tristega: <entryFree id="n49201" type="greek" key="triste^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĕga</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/stega,</foreign> <sense id="n49201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">third stories</hi> or <hi rend="ital">floors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 12, 41, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 4, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 42, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tristi: <entryFree id="n49202" type="main" key="tristi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristi</orth> = trivisti, v. tero.</entryFree>
tristiculus: <entryFree id="n49203" type="main" key="tristi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tristis], <hi rend="ital">somewhat sorrowful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather sad</hi>: filiola, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl>; M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tristificus: <entryFree id="n49204" type="main" key="tristi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tristis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n49204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saddening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: tyrannus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum acore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tristimonia: <entryFree id="n49205" type="main" key="tristi^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tristis</etym>, <sense id="n49205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrowfulness</hi>, = tristitia (very rare): tristimoniā sollicitari, Auct. B. Afr. 10, 3: tristimoniam Ex animo deturbavit, Novat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl> M. (Com. Rel. v. 40 Rib.).—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in tristimonio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tristis: <entryFree id="n49206" type="main" key="tristis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. trastas, frightened; and Lat. terreo</etym>, <sense id="n49206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrowful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dejected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconsolate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trist</hi> (syn.: maestus, severus, austerus, luctuosus). </sense><sense id="n49206.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">maesti tristesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maestus errares, quaerere ex te, quid tristis esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis et conturbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis, demissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tristes affatus amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sequanos tristes, capite demisso, terram intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ego te tristiorem Vidi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt hilarem tristes, tristemque jocosi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(faciet) hominem ex tristi lepidum et lenem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu tristis es?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid es tam tristis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malle se adulescentem tristem quam hilarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis Erat et me maestum videbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49206.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49206.3" n="1" level="3"> Of things associated with misfortune or suggestive of sadness, <hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saddening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhappy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuum laetissimum diem cum tristissimo meo conferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vel defensus tristibus temporibus vel ornatus secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse vultu tristi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristissima exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristissimi exsilii solatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristissimam exegimus noctem,</quote> <trans><tr>most miserable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <trans><tr>unhappy</tr>, <tr>miserable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae,</quote> <trans><tr>sad</tr>, <tr>dismal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium (exsequiarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars subiere feretro, Triste ministerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:571" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristique palus inamabilis undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>gloomy</tr>, <tr>sombre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 40, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspectus (arboris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 22, 40, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes et squalidi trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49206.4" n="2" level="3"> Of taste: <cit><quote lang="la">quod triste et amarum est,</quote> <trans><tr>harsh</tr>, <tr>disagreeable</tr>, <tr>bitter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:281" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 281</bibl></cit>: sapor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49206.5" n="3" level="3"> Of smell, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelitus oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 521</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49206.6" n="4" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">triste</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sad thing</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">triste lupus stabulis, maturis frugibus imbres, Arboribus venti,</quote> <trans><tr>a sad thing</tr>, <tr>a pest</tr>, <tr>bane</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum miscentur tristia laetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:463" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 463</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego mitibus Mutare quaero tristia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 26</bibl></cit>. Thus Ovid called his elegies that were written in exile Tristia.—</sense><sense id="n49206.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49206.8" n="A" level="2"> Of behavior, etc., towards others. </sense><sense id="n49206.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Glum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peevish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-humored</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">tetricus, severus, austerus): stultitia est, ei te esse tristem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: eia, mea Juno, non decet te esse tam <pb n="1902" /> <cb n="TRIS" /> tristem tuo Jovi, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: mihi erit tristior, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 410, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis amica ingrato viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navita tristis (Charon),</quote> <trans><tr>gloomy</tr>, <tr>sullen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 315</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erinys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 409</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49206.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex tristis et integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristibus severe, cum remissis jucunde vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49206.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">truculentis oculis, tristi fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronte gravi et tristi supercilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:41:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 41, 3</bibl></cit>: idem naturā tristiori paululo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 410, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus severior et tristior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis severitas inest in vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita tristior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste et severum genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 113</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo tristis (opp. jocosus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: senectus, Verg. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis et plenus dignitatis sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfert in judiciis tristem et impexam antiquitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>.—Of languages, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tua tristia dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĕ</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sadly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrowfully; harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:19" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste et acutum resonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigens frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flere tristius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes gravius aegrotant, tristius curantur,</quote> <trans><tr>with more difficulty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere tristius,</quote> <trans><tr>more harshly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tristitas: <entryFree id="n49207" type="main" key="tristi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tristis</etym>, <sense id="n49207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sadness</hi> (anteclass.), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 182, 2</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 182:4" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 182, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tristitia: <entryFree id="n49208" type="main" key="tristi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloominess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dejection</hi> (class.; syn. maestitia). </sense><sense id="n49208.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49208.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ad tristitiam, tum ad laetitiam est contorquendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex summā laetitiā atque lasciviā repente omnes tristitia invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eādem tristitiā permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: magno metu ac tristitiā sollicitari, Auct. B. Afr. 10: lacrimis ac tristitiā te tradidisti, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu sapiens finire memento Tristitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam compescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquam cognatam tristitiae voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vino) tristitia et cura hebetatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam animi resolvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 15, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitā tristitiā implicatis militum animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristitiā et maerore in vitā remanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam ad ultimam perductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol recedens quasi tristitiā quādam contrahit terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49208.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tristitia temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>this sad state of the times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indurata soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 11, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenitate verbi rei tristitiam mitigare,</quote> <trans><tr>hardness</tr>, <tr>harshness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49208.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of demeanor, <hi rend="ital">moroseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sourness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloominess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, etc. (syn. severitas): <cit><quote lang="la">an nova tristitiae causa puella tuae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simque ego tristitiae causa modusque tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(risus) tristitiam ac severitatem mitigat, relaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum (philosophorum) tristitiam atque asperitatem fugiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille vos tristitiā vultuque deceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Quint. Inst. prooem. § 15: non conveniant barbae illi atque tristitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:612" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 612</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tristities: <entryFree id="n49209" type="main" key="tristi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> <etym>id.</etym>, = tristitia, <sense id="n49209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grief</hi> (ante- and postclass.): vultum alligat quae tristities? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 182, 2</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 59 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: tristitie, Turp. ap. Non. l. l. (Com. Rel. v. 126 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 231, 2; 10, p. 239, 18.—</sense><sense id="n49209.1" n="II" level="1"> Personified, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tristĭtĭes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a maid of Psyche</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tristitudo: <entryFree id="n49210" type="main" key="tristi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dejection</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnem de tuo pectore tristitudinem mitte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 295, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tristor: <entryFree id="n49211" type="main" key="tristor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tristor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n49211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to be sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grieved</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">downcast</hi> (very rare): numquam <cb n="TRIT" /> flere, numquam tristari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 2, 3</bibl>; id. Ira, 2, 7, 1.</sense></entryFree>
trisulcus: <entryFree id="n49212" type="main" key="tri^sulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-sulcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭsulcis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Rusp. Ep. 9</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter</etym> (having three furrows), <sense id="n49212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three-cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three-forked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threepointed; threefold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triple</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lingua (serpentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 475</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo, of the serpent in Paradise,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine trisulco quatit ora fragor, of the teeth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:500" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 500</bibl></cit>: fulmen, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 448, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=352" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 352</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Jovis telum trisulcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:467" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 848</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 145</bibl></cit>: fores, <hi rend="ital">folding in three parts</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 449</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <trans><tr>threeforked</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trisyllabus: <entryFree id="n49213" type="greek" key="tri^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">trisu/llabos</foreign>, <sense id="n49213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trisyllabic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 91</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 522</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trit: <entryFree id="n49214" type="main" key="trit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trit</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n49214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cry of a mouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a squeak</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 213</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 11 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tritannus: <entryFree id="n49215" type="main" key="Tritannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tritannus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tributanus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gladiator famous for his bodily strength</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 81</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tritavia: <entryFree id="n49216" type="main" key="tri^ta^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭtăvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tritavus</etym>, <sense id="n49216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of an</hi> atavus <hi rend="ital">or</hi> atavia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:58:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 58, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:58:10:10" default="NO">58, 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tritavus: <entryFree id="n49217" type="main" key="tri^ta^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭtăvus</orth> (old sibilated collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭtăvus</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=314" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 314</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>teravus</etym>, <sense id="n49217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of an</hi> atavus <hi rend="ital">or</hi> atavia. </sense><sense id="n49217.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:58:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 58, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:58:10:10" default="NO">58, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; Fest. l. l.—* </sense><sense id="n49217.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">remote ancestors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trite: <entryFree id="n49218" type="greek" key="tri^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/th</foreign>; in music, <sense id="n49218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the third string</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tone</hi> in the musical scale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tritemoria: <entryFree id="n49219" type="greek" key="tri^te_mo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭtēmŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trithmori/a</foreign>; <sense id="n49219.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in music,</quote> <trans><tr>a third</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 930</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 959</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trithales: <entryFree id="n49220" type="greek" key="tri^tha^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭthăles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triqale/s</foreign>, i. q. erithales, <sense id="n49220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wall-pepper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lesser houseleek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tritia: <entryFree id="n49221" type="main" key="Tri_ti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītīa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tritai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n49221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inland town of Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the confines of Elis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastritzi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trittenses</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītienses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tritia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triticeus: <entryFree id="n49222" type="main" key="tri_ti^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītĭcĕus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trītĭcēĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 58</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triticum</etym>, <sense id="n49222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of wheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheat-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 486</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:693" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paleae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furfures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">far,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triticiarius: <entryFree id="n49223" type="main" key="tri_ti^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to wheat</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">condictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13</bibl></cit>, tit. 3.</sense></entryFree>
triticinus: <entryFree id="n49224" type="hapax" key="tri_ti^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of wheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheat-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amylum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triticum: <entryFree id="n49225" type="main" key="tri_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from tritus, from tero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 106</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n49225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wheat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:63 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 63 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:73:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 73, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tritomus: <entryFree id="n49226" type="main" key="tri^to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭtŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/tomos</foreign>, <sense id="n49226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triton: <entryFree id="n49227" type="main" key="Tri_to_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis or ōnŏs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tri/twn</foreign>. <sense id="n49227.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Neptune and the nymph Salacia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the bidding of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blows through a shell to calm or rouse the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 333</bibl> sq.; 13, 919; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 348</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tritones, sea-gods that serve the other gods,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 824</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49227.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49227.2" n="1" level="3"> A humorous designation of <hi rend="ital">a lover of fish-ponds</hi>: piscinarum Tritones, qs. <hi rend="ital">fish-pond gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49227.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish of the genus</hi> pelamides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49227.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 209</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49227.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river and lake in Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Lesser Syrtis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to Egypto-Grecian fables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Minerva was born</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:722" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 722</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49227.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lake Triton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tritonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 704</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 483</bibl></cit>; more freq., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītō-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 783</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 270</bibl>; 6, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 655</bibl> et saep.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītōnĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 893</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49227.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tritonian</hi>: palus, <hi rend="ital">a miry sea near Pallene</hi>, <cb n="TRIU" /> <hi rend="ital">in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 358</bibl>: harundo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> tibia <hi rend="ital">invented by Pallas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:384" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 384</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49227.8" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lake Triton;</hi> or, transf., <hi rend="ital">to Pallas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Palladian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <trans><tr>Lake Triton</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:322" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 750</bibl></cit>: arx, <hi rend="ital">the citadel of Pallas</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 794</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:645" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ship Argo</tr>, <tr>built at the suggestion of Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 47</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trītōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n49227.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lake Triton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:297" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:185" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 185</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49227.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pallas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 547</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tritonide fertiles Athenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the olive-tree planted by Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tritopatreus: <entryFree id="n49228" type="main" key="Tritopa^treus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tritopătreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Jupiter by Proserpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl> B. and K. (al. Tritopatores).</sense></entryFree>
tritor: <entryFree id="n49229" type="main" key="tri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tero</etym>, <sense id="n49229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chafer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a grinder of colors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 145</bibl></cit>: compedium, <hi rend="ital">a chain-rubber</hi>, a term of reproach applied to a chained slave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulorum, of one who is often scourged,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: ARGENTARIVS, i. e. caelator, Inscr. Rein. cl. 11, n. 97.</sense></entryFree>
tritura: <entryFree id="n49230" type="main" key="tri_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wearing off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chafing.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n49230.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">muli pectora copulae sparteae triturā continuā exulcerati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49230.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a threshing</hi>, of grain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO">1, 6, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trituratio: <entryFree id="n49231" type="main" key="tri_tu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trituro</etym>, <sense id="n49231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threshing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joan. 27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joan. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
triturator: <entryFree id="n49232" type="main" key="tri_tu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thresher</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Don. 10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Don. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trituro: <entryFree id="n49233" type="main" key="tri_tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tritura, II.</etym>, <sense id="n49233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thresh</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bos triturans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paleam areae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Johan. 4:section=2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Johan. 4, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 15, 13, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">passionum flagellis triturari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tritus: <entryFree id="n49234" type="main" key="tri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n49234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi> of tero.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49235" type="main" key="tri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (found only in <sense id="n49235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing</hi>: lapidum conflictu atque tritu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 66</bibl> (al. attritu); 34, 12, 30, § 120 (dub.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triumphalis: <entryFree id="n49236" type="main" key="tri^umpha_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumphālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triumpho</etym>, <sense id="n49236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be longing to a triumph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumphal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the conquest of which entitled the general to a triumph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <trans><tr>through which the triumphing general entered Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictā Veste triumphales senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:364" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans><tr>a triumphal chariot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>which the triumphant person wore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 3, 4, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: ornamenta (usually consisting of a corona aurea, toga picta, tunica palmata, scipio eburneus, etc.; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 9</bibl>, and 30, 15, 11), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 15</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-umphālĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the triumphal ornaments</hi> (and under the emperors also granted to a general without the ceremonies of a triumph), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triumphali miscetur auro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the triumphal garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 55, 81, § 171</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans><tr>who has had the honors of a triumph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:364" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 364</bibl></cit>; and, more freq., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-umphālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has had the honors of a triumph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of generals who had celebrated a triumph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triumphator: <entryFree id="n49237" type="main" key="tri^umpha_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumphātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who triumphs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triumpher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conqueror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquisher</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n49237.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Samnitibus triumphator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 285, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 15, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49237.2" n="B" level="2"> Triumphator, an epithet of Jupiter, App. de Mundo, 75, 10.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of Hercules,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1042</bibl></cit>.—Of the Roman emperors, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49237.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erroris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triumphatorius: <entryFree id="n49238" type="main" key="tri^umpha_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumphātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triumphator</etym>, <sense id="n49238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to one who triumphs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumphing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumphant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
triumphatrix: <entryFree id="n49239" type="gloss" key="Tri^umpha_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭumphātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (she that triumphs), <sense id="n49239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Triumphant</hi>, a name given to the ninth legion, because they triumphed over the younger Pompey in Spain, Labus. ap. Gazzett. di Venez. ann. 1833, n. 56.</sense></entryFree>
triumpho: <entryFree id="n49240" type="main" key="tri^umpho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumpho</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n49240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> <pb n="1903" /> <cb n="TRIU" /> [triumphus]. </sense><sense id="n49240.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a triumphal procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrate a triumph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to triumph</hi> (cf. ovo). </sense><sense id="n49240.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: triumphare appellatum, quod cum imperatore milites redeuntes clamitant per urbem in Capitolium eunti Io triumphe: id a <foreign lang="greek">qria/mbw|</foreign> Graeco Liberi cognomento potest dictum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 68</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praeturā triumphare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissi sunt iis magistratus, in quibus re bene gestā triumpharent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanus, qui de Numantinis triumpharat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ex Transalpinis gentibus triumpharunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Macedoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Transalpinis bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum triumphantem (Camillum) albi per urbem vexerant equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut triumphanti urbem inire liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi debellato triumphare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem ad eam diem triumphasse, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam inauditum quam equitem Romanum triumphare? at Pompeius triumphavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi meo in rem publicam beneficio ubi triumpharet esset habiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. Auct. B. Afr. 22, 3: Nero ovans triumphavit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">held</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrated an ovation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:96:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 96, 3</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sit mulsum, qui triumphent milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum, si de me jure triumphat Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit> (8, b), 40 (24): <cit><quote lang="la">deque cothurnato vate triumphat Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 18</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eā urbe triumphari vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis est Romae, qui triumphari de Macedonibus nolit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi jussu triumphatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 63, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de parvis oppidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex civilibus bellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49240.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to triumph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be glad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejoice exceedingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare laetitiā, triumphare gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetaris tu in omnium gemitu et triumphas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo exsultat et triumphat oratio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumpho, si licet me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: meum factum probari abs te, triumpho gaudio, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49240.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n49240.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphavit cum imperatoribus suis triumphos novem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n49240.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With other objects, <hi rend="ital">to triumph over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead in triumph;</hi> or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to conquer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem, Treb. XXX. Tyr. 24: hic terram triumphabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem Cum suis terroribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 26, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mort. Pers. 16</bibl>.—More freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisque triumphatas utroque ab litore gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphatis dare jura Medis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zenobia victa et triumphata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphati magis quam victi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphata Capitolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 836</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia superata et triumphata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne triumpharetur (Mithridates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma triumphati caput orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: triumphatus bos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">obtained by victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">got</hi> or <hi rend="ital">won as booty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:732" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 732</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">triumphatum aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaeos triumphandos Mummio tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 61" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 61</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">p. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭ-umphans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, = triumphalis, <hi rend="ital">triumphal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to a triumph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triumphus: <entryFree id="n49241" type="main" key="triumphus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triumphus</orth> (in the earliest per. written <orth extent="full" lang="la">triumpus</orth>; <sense id="n49241.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>; and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl>; and the letter P), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">qri/ambos</foreign>, a hymn in honor of Bacchus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n49241.1" n="I" level="1"> TRIVMPE, <hi rend="ital">an exclamation used in the solemn processions of the Arval brothers</hi>: ENOS MARMOR IVVATO. TRIVMPE, TRIVMPE, TRIVMPE, Carm. Fratr. Arv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2270</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49241.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A solemn and magnificent entrance of a general into Rome after having obtained an important victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triumphal procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumph</hi> (cf. Smith, Antiq. 1163 sqq.): <cit><quote lang="la">disseres de triumpho. Quid tandem habet iste currus? quid vincti ante currum duces! quid simulacra oppidorum? quid aurum? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 29, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum deportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in triumpho duceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallos Caesar in triumphum ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus cum triumphum Africano decerneret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de classe populi Romani triumphum agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 39, § 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum ex Etruriā agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: deportare triumphum ex <cb n="TRIV" /> provinciā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boiorum triumphi spem collegae reliquit,</quote> <trans><tr>for a victory over the Boii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharsalicae pugnae ne triumphum quidem egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per triumphum aliquem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 8</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">triumpho clarissimo urbem est invectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos ducere in triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 45, § 139</bibl></cit>: (res) justissimi triumphi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">worthy of a triumph</hi>, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pompeius) tot habet triumphos, quot orae sunt partesque terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albi greges ... Romanos ad templa deūm duxere triumphos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were carried before the processions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 148</bibl></cit>.—The shout of the soldiery and the multitude on occasion of these triumphal processions was: <cit><quote lang="la">Io triumphe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit> and 50; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49241.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a triumph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut repulsam tuam triumphum suum duxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 16, 39</bibl></cit>: luxuriae (<hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triumvir: <entryFree id="n49242" type="main" key="tri^umvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumvir</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype>, v. triumviri.</entryFree>
triumviralis: <entryFree id="n49243" type="main" key="tri^umvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triumviri</etym>, <sense id="n49243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the triumvirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumviral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectus flagellis triumviralibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the superintendents of prisons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: proscriptio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> triumvirorum reipublicae constituendae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triumviratus: <entryFree id="n49244" type="main" key="tri^umvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭumvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of a triumvir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the triumvirate</hi>: triumviratus (coloniae deducendae), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatu ante gesto triumviratibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne triumviratu suo (reipublicae constituendae) nimis superbiat Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 59, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo more triumviratus invaditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae constituendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs legendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
