triumviri: <entryFree id="n49245" type="main" key="triumvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">triumvĭri</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">tresvĭri</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">IIIvĭri</orth>), <itype>ōrum or ūm</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tres-vir</etym>, <sense id="n49245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three men holding an office together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">associated in public business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a board of three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three joint commissioners</hi> appointed for various purposes, <hi rend="ital">a triumvirate.</hi> So, </sense><sense id="n49245.1" n="I" level="1"> Triumviri coloniae deducendae or agro dando, <hi rend="ital">for leading out a colony and distributing the land among its members</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 21, 4</bibl>; 8, 16, 14 al.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas ... Gaium Gracchum ... triumvirum coloniis deducundis ferro necaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumvir agrarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 21, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.2" n="II" level="1"> Triumviri capitales, <hi rend="ital">superintendents of public prisons</hi>, who performed many of the duties of modern police magistrates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carceris lautumiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 14, 10</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49245.3" n="III" level="1"> Triumviri Epulones, v. epulo.—</sense><sense id="n49245.4" n="IV" level="1"> Triumviri monetales, <hi rend="ital">directors of the mint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.5" n="V" level="1"> Triumviri mensarii, <hi rend="ital">three commissioners to regulate money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 36, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.6" n="VI" level="1"> Triumviri nocturni, <hi rend="ital">fire-wardens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.7" n="VII" level="1"> Triumviri reipublicae constituendae; <cit><quote lang="la">these were Antony, Octavianus, and Lepidus, appointed to regulate public affairs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 6</bibl>.— In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.8" n="VIII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Boards for recruiting troops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus triumviros binos creari jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.9" n="IX" level="1"> Triumviri sacris conquirendis donisque persignandis, <hi rend="ital">to collect and register votive offerings</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.10" n="X" level="1"> Triumviri reficiendis aedibus Fortunae et matris Matutae et Spei, <hi rend="ital">for the restoration of temples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49245.11" n="XI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The three chief magistrates of a municipality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Manlius, qui tum erat IIIvir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triuncis: <entryFree id="n49246" type="main" key="tri^uncis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭuncis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ter-uncia</etym>, <sense id="n49246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of three</hi> unciae: paragaudis, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trivenefica: <entryFree id="n49247" type="hapax" key="tri^ve^ne_fi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭvĕnēfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ter-veneficus</etym>, <sense id="n49247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arrant poison-mixer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thorough hag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sorceress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trivia: <entryFree id="n49248" type="main" key="Tri^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. trivius.</entryFree>
trivialis: <entryFree id="n49249" type="main" key="tri^vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trivium; prop. that is in or belongs to the cross-roads or public streets; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n49249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be found everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivial</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">trivialis scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: verba (opp. <cb n="TROE" /> splendide atque adornate declamare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludii ex circo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:28" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trivialiter: <entryFree id="n49250" type="main" key="tri^vi^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭvĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>trivialis</etym>, <sense id="n49250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a common manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trivialiter et populariter instituti infantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triviatim: <entryFree id="n49251" type="hapax" key="tri^vi^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭvĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>trivium</etym>, <sense id="n49251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the public streets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissultare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trivicum: <entryFree id="n49252" type="main" key="Tri^vi_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭvīcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in the mountains between Samnium and Apulia</hi>, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Trevico</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trivium: <entryFree id="n49253" type="main" key="tri^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ter-via</etym>. <sense id="n49253.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place where three roads meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fork in the roads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross-road</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ventum est in trivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49253.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a public square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the public street</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highway; plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triviis aut in compitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnisque Hecate triviis ululata per urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 609</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurram in triviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 245</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros in trivio docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl> (22).—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">arripere maledictum ex trivio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>out of the street</tr>, <tr>from the mob</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trivius: <entryFree id="n49254" type="main" key="tri^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n49254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. fem.</hi> Triviaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 84</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trivium</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of those deities whose temples were often erected where three ways met</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 84, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1015, 1</bibl>: virgo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Hecate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called: Trivia dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 30), 10.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭ-vĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 16</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 318 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:5" default="NO" valid="yes">66, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:389" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:416 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 416 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcus Trĭvĭae</orth> (the Lake of Diana), <hi rend="ital">a lake in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Aricia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Nemi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trixago: <entryFree id="n49255" type="main" key="trixa_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trixāgo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trissāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> chamaedrys, <hi rend="ital">germander</hi>: Teucrium chamaedrys, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
troas: <entryFree id="n49256" type="main" key="Tro_a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. 1. Tros, B. 5.</entryFree>
trochaeides: <entryFree id="n49257" type="greek" key="tro^chaei_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏchaeīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">troxaieidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a trochee</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 992</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trochaeus: <entryFree id="n49258" type="greek" key="tro^chaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏchaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">troxai=os</foreign> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 988</bibl>). <sense id="n49258.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A metrical foot of two syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a long and a short</hi> (— <cit><quote lang="la">˘),</quote> <trans><tr>a trochee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 80</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 8 praef.—</sense><sense id="n49258.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for the</hi> tribrachys, <hi rend="ital">a metrical foot of three short syllables</hi> (˘ <cit><quote lang="la">˘ ˘),</quote> <trans><tr>a tribrach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:193" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trochaicus: <entryFree id="n49259" type="greek" key="tro^cha^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏchăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">troxai+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of trochees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trochaic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2437" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2437</bibl> P.; Diom. pp. 504 and 508 ib.</sense></entryFree>
trochilus: <entryFree id="n49260" type="greek" key="tro^chi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏchĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tro/xilos</foreign>. <sense id="n49260.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very small bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the golden-crested wren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trochil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 25, 37, § 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49260.1" n="II" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">a semicircular hollow running round the base of a column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a casement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trochil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
trochiscus: <entryFree id="n49261" type="greek" key="tro^chiscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏchiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">troxi/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n49261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round ball;</hi> in medicine, <hi rend="ital">a pill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troche</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trochisk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:104" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
trochlea: <entryFree id="n49262" type="main" key="trochle^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trochlĕa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">troclĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from <foreign lang="greek">troxali/a</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mechanical contrivance for raising weights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a case</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sheaf containing one or more pulleys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a block</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:905" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 905</bibl>.—Prov.: trochleis pituitam adducere, q. s. <hi rend="ital">to draw up phlegm with a hoisting-tackle</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to hawk violently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trochleatim: <entryFree id="n49263" type="hapax" key="trochle^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trochlĕātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>trochlea</etym>, <sense id="n49263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a block</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erecto fune,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
trochus: <entryFree id="n49264" type="greek" key="tro^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">troxo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an iron hoop set round with small rings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trundling-hoop</hi> for children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl> (4, 13), 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 383</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 486</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:168:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 168, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:169:2 al" default="NO">14, 169, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
trocmi: <entryFree id="n49265" type="main" key="Trocmi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trocmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trogmi</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
troes: <entryFree id="n49266" type="main" key="Tro_es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. 1. Tros, B. 4.</entryFree>
troezen: <entryFree id="n49267" type="main" key="Troeze_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Troezēn</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*troizh/n</foreign>, <sense id="n49267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient city of Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Pittheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the maternal grandfather of Theseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reigned</hi>, near the mod. village of <hi rend="ital">Damala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 418</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope Troezena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:296" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 296</bibl></cit>; 15, 506; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 16, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:81" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 81</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Troezēnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <pb n="1904" /> <cb n="TROP" /> <hi rend="ital">beionging to Trœzen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lelex</tr>, <tr>son of Pittheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 566</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Troezēnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Trœzen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trogini: <entryFree id="n49268" type="main" key="Trogini"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trogini</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
troglodytae: <entryFree id="n49269" type="main" key="Tro_glo^dy^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōglŏdytae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōgŏdytae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trwglodu/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n49269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Ethiopia who dwelt in caves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Troglodytes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8:6" default="NO">1, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 8, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:168" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29, 33, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49269.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōglŏdytĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōgŏdytĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Troglodytes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Troglodytic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 21, 46, § 101</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōglŏdy-tĭcē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōgŏdytĭcē</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Trogiodytes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:178:2:74:76:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 71, § 178, 2, 74, 76, § 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:169" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29, 34, § 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49269.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trō-glŏdytis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōgŏdytis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Troglodytic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 90" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trogmi: <entryFree id="n49270" type="main" key="Trogmi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trogmi</orth>, v. Trocmi.</entryFree>
troguspompeius: <entryFree id="n49271" type="main" key="Trogus Pompe_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trogus Pompēĭus</orth>, <sense id="n49271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman historian in the time of Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose work was abridged by Justin</hi>, Just. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:38:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:43:1" default="NO">43, 1</bibl> and 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 114, § 274</bibl>; v. Teuffel, Rö. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 253.</sense></entryFree>
troia: <entryFree id="n49272" type="main" key="Tro_i^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Tros, A.</entryFree>
troiades: <entryFree id="n49273" type="main" key="Tro_i^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. 1. Tros, B. 6.</entryFree>
troicus: <entryFree id="n49274" type="main" key="Tro_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Tros, B. 3.</entryFree>
troilus: <entryFree id="n49275" type="main" key="Tro_i^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trw/i+los</foreign>, <sense id="n49275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Priam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 474</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
troius: <entryFree id="n49276" type="main" key="Tro_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Tros, B. 1.</entryFree>
troja: <entryFree id="n49277" type="main" key="Tro_ja"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōja</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Tros, A.</entryFree>
trojanus: <entryFree id="n49278" type="main" key="Tro_ja_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōjānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Tros, B. 2.</entryFree>
trojugena: <entryFree id="n49279" type="main" key="Tro_ju^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōjŭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Troja-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n49279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Troy-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born in Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Trojan descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 465</bibl></cit>: Romanus, <hi rend="ital">descended from Trojans</hi>, Vet. Carm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. m.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49279.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 359</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49279.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:95" default="NO">11, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tromentinatribus: <entryFree id="n49280" type="main" key="Tromenti_na tri^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tromentīna trĭbus</orth>, <sense id="n49280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the</hi> tribus rusticae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1109, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tropa: <entryFree id="n49281" type="main" key="tro^pa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">troph/</foreign>, <sense id="n49281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tropic solstice</hi>: CHIMERINA, Kal. Vet. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 381</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49282" type="main" key="tro^pa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpa</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n49282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turning;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tro/pa</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott, s. v.): et ludit tropa nequiore talo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at a game played by throwing dice</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:14:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 14, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tropaeatus: <entryFree id="n49283" type="main" key="tro^paea_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpaeātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tropaeum</etym>, <sense id="n49283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trophied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned with trophies</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">victores et tropaeati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tropaeophorus: <entryFree id="n49284" type="main" key="Tro^paeo^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŏpaeŏphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tropaiofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n49284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Tropny-bearer</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, App. de Mundo, p. 75, 11.</sense></entryFree>
tropaeum: <entryFree id="n49285" type="greek" key="tro^paeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpaeum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏphaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tropaion</foreign>. <sense id="n49285.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sign and memorial of victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trophy;</hi> orig. a trunk of a tree, on which were fixed the arms, shields, helmets, etc., taken from the enemy; <cit><quote lang="la">afterwards made of stone and ornamented in the same manner,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devictis Hispanis tropaea in jugis constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">in modum tropaeorum arma imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere Romae tropaea de Parthis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:379" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1</bibl>, ext. 3; 2, 2, 3.—</sense><sense id="n49285.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49285.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova Cantemus Augusti tropaea Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tulit e capto nota tropaea viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria, quae cum Marathonio possit compararitropaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra sunt tropaea, nostra monimenta, nostri triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14</bibl>, ext. 1. —</sense><sense id="n49285.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">memorial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monument</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaeum necessitudinis atque hospitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenatis erunt vera tropaea fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 34.</sense></entryFree>
tropaeus: <entryFree id="n49286" type="greek" key="tro^paeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tropai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n49286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turning back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">returning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <trans><tr>blowing from the sea towards the land</tr>, <tr>sea-breezes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trophonius: <entryFree id="n49287" type="main" key="Tro^pho_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŏphōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trofw/nios</foreign>. <sense id="n49287.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brother of Agamedes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in conjunction with</hi> <cb n="TROS" /> <hi rend="ital">whom he built the temple of Apollo at Delphi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49287.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A deity that imparted oracles in a cave near Lebadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bœotia;</hi> sometimes called also Juppiter Trophonius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 11, § 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŏphōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Trophonius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trophonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratio Chaeronis,</quote> <trans><tr>of a certain Chœron</tr>, <tr>who descended into Trophonius's cave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tropice: <entryFree id="n49288" type="main" key="tro^pi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tropicus <sense id="n49288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tropicus: <entryFree id="n49289" type="greek" key="tro^pi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tropiko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n49289.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tropical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capricornus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where the sun turns back</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 16, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Ecl. de Ratione Diei Anni, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 614</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49289.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n49289.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">changes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alterations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae cupiditas haec tropica instituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49289.3" n="B" level="2"> In the later rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">figurative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaphorical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tropical</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 31</bibl></cit>: locutiones, Aug. contra Mendac. 10.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui maluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. ad Lit. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Genes. ad Lit. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tropis: <entryFree id="n49290" type="greek" key="tro^pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tro/pis</foreign>, <sense id="n49290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lees of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:83:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 83, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tropologia: <entryFree id="n49291" type="greek" key="tro^po^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tropologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n49291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figurative manner of speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a metaphorical</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tropical style</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tropology</hi>, Hier. in Joel, 2, 18.</sense></entryFree>
tropologice: <entryFree id="n49292" type="main" key="tro^po^lo^gi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpŏlŏgĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tropologicus <sense id="n49292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tropologicus: <entryFree id="n49293" type="greek" key="tro^po^lo^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpŏlŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tropologiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figurative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tropical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tropological</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tropologicum et figuratum genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Joan. Hierosol. 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpŏlŏ-gĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaphorically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Soph. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Ezech. 1, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tropus: <entryFree id="n49294" type="greek" key="tro^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tro/pos</foreign>. <sense id="n49294.0" n="I" level="1"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figurative use of a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trope</hi> (postAug. for translatio, verborum immutatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:44" default="NO">9, 2, 44</bibl> sq.; 9, 3, 20 al.— </sense><sense id="n49294.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A manner of singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a song</hi>, Ven. Carm. 10, 10, 54; 10, 10, 60; 10, 12, 4.</sense></entryFree>
tros: <entryFree id="n49295" type="main" key="Tro_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōs</orth>, <itype>Trōis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trw/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whom Troy was named; he was the son of Erichthonius and grandson of Dardanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:297" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 297</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 19</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49295.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōja</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city of Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:199 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 199 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 404</bibl> sq.— </sense><sense id="n49295.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49295.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A place founded by Æneas in the Laurentine territory in Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49295.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A place settled by Helenus in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 721</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 349</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49295.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman game played on horseback</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of sham-fight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:596 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 596 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49295.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 596</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æsacus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:773" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit> (Troica, Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 306</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaza,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49295.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōjānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 88, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 121</bibl></cit>: ludi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the game of Troy</hi> (v. 2. c. supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>.— Prov.: equus Trojanus, for <hi rend="ital">a concealed danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a secret artifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus, intus inquam est equus Trojanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>. —Equus Trojanus is also <hi rend="ital">the title of a tragedy of Nœvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 2</bibl>.— <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n49295.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōjāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 702</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49295.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trō-jānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a country-place in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49295.10" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 730</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>the perpetual fire which was kept in the temple of Vesta at Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49295.11" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōs</orth>, <itype>ōis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Trojan.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 574</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 52</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 325</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 265</bibl>; 12, 137; Ov H. 1, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>, <cb n="TRUC" /> 269.—</sense><sense id="n49295.12" n="5" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōăs</orth>, <itype>ădis or ădŏs</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agro Troade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:16:183" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 16, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 84" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 84</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n49295.13" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n49295.14" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 566</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 421</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 613</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49295.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Troas, <hi rend="ital">the title of a tragedy by Q. Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 6, 7</bibl>: Troades, <hi rend="ital">the title of a tragedy by Seneca.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49295.16" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The region about Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Troad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18" default="NO">1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO">2, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49295.17" n="6" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n49296" type="main" key="Tro_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trōs</orth>, <itype>ōis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. Tros, B. 4.</entryFree>
trosmis: <entryFree id="n49297" type="main" key="Trosmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trosmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*trosmi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lower Mœsia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Ister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trossuli: <entryFree id="n49298" type="main" key="Trossu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trossŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given to the Roman cavalry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from</hi> Trossulum, <hi rend="ital">a town of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was conquered by them</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 3</bibl>; cf.: Junius Gracchanus in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 9, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll.— In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:82" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 82</bibl> Schol.—In the Aug. per., a name used in contempt for <hi rend="ital">fops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coxcombs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 9</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 76:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
troxalis: <entryFree id="n49299" type="greek" key="troxa^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">troxălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trocali/s</foreign>, <sense id="n49299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insect resembling a grasshopper</hi>, perhaps a <hi rend="ital">cricket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 16, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trua: <entryFree id="n49300" type="main" key="tru^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n49300.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stirring-spoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skimmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ladle</hi>, Titin. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 17 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n49300.1" n="II" level="1"> Perh. <hi rend="ital">a drain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spout</hi>, acc. to Varr. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
trucidatio: <entryFree id="n49301" type="main" key="tru^ci_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcīdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trucido</etym>, <sense id="n49301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slaughtering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">massacring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butchery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49301.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde non jam pugna, sed trucidatio velut pecorum fleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. absol.</hi>: tantas trucidationes facis, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49301.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cutting to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting off</hi>, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <trans><tr>a lopping</tr>, <tr>trimming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 45, § 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trucidator: <entryFree id="n49302" type="main" key="tru^ci_da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcīdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slaughterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 105 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
trucido: <entryFree id="n49303" type="main" key="tru^ci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcīdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. for truci-cidare, i. e. truncum caedere</etym>, <sense id="n49303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kill cruelly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">massacre</hi> (class.; syn.: obtrunco, jugulo, perimo). </sense><sense id="n49303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavete neu capti sicut pecora trucidemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus diripi, trucidari, Auct. B. Afr. 20, 6: cives Romanos necandos trucidandosque curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hic ibidem ante oculos vestros trucidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trucidando occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ferro trucidari oportebat, eos nondum voce vulnero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pueros coram populo Medea trucidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trucidatae legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissum corpus ignobili saevitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49303.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demolish; to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu pisces seu porrum et caepe trucidas,</quote> <trans><tr>chew up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (nubes) multo si forte umore recepit Ignem, continuo magno clamore trucidat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>extinguishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus ne effundat patrimonium, ne fenore trucidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem fenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 37, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tructa: <entryFree id="n49304" type="greek" key="tructa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tructa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trw/kths</foreign>, <sense id="n49304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of trout</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 6</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">truc-tus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
truculente: <entryFree id="n49305" type="main" key="tru^cu^lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcŭlentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. truculentus <sense id="n49305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
truculentia: <entryFree id="n49306" type="main" key="tru^cu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>truculentus</etym>, <sense id="n49306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truculence</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>harshness</tr>, <tr>inclemency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
truculentus: <entryFree id="n49307" type="main" key="tru^cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trux</etym>, <sense id="n49307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: saevus, crudelis, trux). </sense><sense id="n49307.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestis, saevus, tristis, parcus, truculentus, tenax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam taeter incedebat! quam truculentus! quam terribilis aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truculentus atque saevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 558</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris etiam feris ceteris truculenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŭcŭlentus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a play by Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla Getis gens est truculentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo truculentior visu foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feta truculentior ursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam invasit truculentior quam antea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49307.2" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">truculentis oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1905" /> <cb n="TRUN" /> 3, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>wild</tr>, <tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocibus truculentis strepere,</quote> <trans><tr>wild</tr>, <tr>tumultuous</tr>, <tr>mutinous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcŭlenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">fierce conduct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truculenta pelagi tulistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truculenta loquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 558</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truculentissimum ac nefarium facinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcŭlentē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcŭ-lenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">savagely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferociously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite truculenter insequi inania verba populorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; Ven. Fort. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:541" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 541</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod truculentius se gereret quam ceteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potuit truculentissime eum aspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trudis: <entryFree id="n49308" type="main" key="tru^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭdis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trudo</etym>, <sense id="n49308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pointed pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 208</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trudes hastae sunt cum lunato ferro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trudo: <entryFree id="n49309" type="main" key="tru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr, tard-, to split</etym>, <sense id="n49309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shove; to crowd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shove forward; to press on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi> (class.; syn.: pello, expello). </sense><sense id="n49309.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49309.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis haec quidem hercle est et trahi et trudi simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas mihi tenebras trudis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trudit et impellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1032" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1032</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverso trudere monte saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1000" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1000</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostes) trudunt adversos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaciem cum flumina trudunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille hinc trudetur largus lacrimarum foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apros in plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad proelia inertem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49309.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of growth, <hi rend="ital">to push forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(pampinus) trudit gemmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de cortice (gemmae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truditur e sicco radix oleagina ligno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: offenso truditur igne latex, Claud. de Apono, 13.—</sense><sense id="n49309.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: secundae res laetitiă transvorsum trudere solent a recte consulendo atque intellegendo, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem trudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: in quae (comitia) omnibus invitis trudit noster Magnus Auli filium, <hi rend="ital">puts forward</hi> (to bring him into office), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ne trudamur, di immortales nos admonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:28:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitia alter alterum trudimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 41:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel in arma trusos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: truditur dies die, Hor, C. 2, 18, 15, cf.: sic vita truditur, <hi rend="ital">is hurried on</hi>, Petr 82: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacia Alia aliam trudit,</quote> <trans><tr>presses hard upon</tr>, <tr>closely follows the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
truentum: <entryFree id="n49310" type="main" key="Tru^entum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŭentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Picenum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Truentus</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Tronto</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŭentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Truentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Truentine</hi>: Castrum, <hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> Truentum, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, B, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:435" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 435</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trŭentī-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Truentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Truentines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trugonus: <entryFree id="n49311" type="main" key="tru_go^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trūgŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = trygon, <sense id="n49311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stingray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trulla: <entryFree id="n49312" type="main" key="trulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>trua</etym>. <sense id="n49312.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small ladle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dipper</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">scoop</hi> (esp. for dipping wine from the crater into the drinking-cups), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:97:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 97, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7</bibl>. § 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:36 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 36 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49312.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49312.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A scoop-shaped fire-pan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 11, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49312.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mason's trowel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49312.4" n="C" level="2"> = trulleum, <hi rend="ital">a basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash-basin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trulleum: <entryFree id="n49313" type="main" key="trulle^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trullĕum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trullĭum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>trulla</etym>, <sense id="n49313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash-basin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:25:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 25, 34</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trullĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">trullĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
