trullissatio: <entryFree id="n49314" type="main" key="trullissa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trullissātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trullisso</etym>, <sense id="n49314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trowelling</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rough casting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plastering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trullisso: <entryFree id="n49315" type="main" key="trullisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trullisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>trulla, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n49315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough-cast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trullium: <entryFree id="n49316" type="main" key="trulli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trullĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. trulleum.</entryFree>
truncatio: <entryFree id="n49317" type="hapax" key="trunca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">truncātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trunco</etym>, <sense id="n49317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maiming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mutilating</hi> by cutting off: digitorum, Cod. Th. 7, 13, 5.</sense></entryFree>
trunco: <entryFree id="n49318" type="main" key="trunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trunco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. truncus</etym>, <sense id="n49318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to maim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shorten</hi> by cutting off, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in <cb n="TRUN" /> post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: mutilo, amputo): truncata simulacra deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuis regis truncatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncat olus foliis,</quote> <trans><tr>strips</tr>, <tr>cuts off the leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncato ex vulneribus corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncatā corporis parte, partem corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 14, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:4" default="NO">15, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 566</bibl></cit>: lacertos, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 411</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to deprive of an eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:541" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibusque truncatus et armis,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of his hands and weapons</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia antiquum illud (signum) vetustate truncatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncatis arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut apart</tr>, <tr>rend asunder</tr>, <tr>separate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gigant. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroos tenores gressu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to shorten hexameters into pentameters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:3:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>.—Pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to kill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:567" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 567</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49318.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc omnibus fere membris erat truncata respublica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. Caes. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trunculus: <entryFree id="n49319" type="main" key="truncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">truncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. truncus</etym>, <sense id="n49319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece cut off</hi> from the body, <hi rend="ital">a bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum,</quote> <trans><tr>pigs' trotters</tr>, <tr>pettitoes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
truncus: <entryFree id="n49320" type="main" key="truncus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">truncus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n49320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [root tark-, truc-, to break, tear; cf. torqueo], <hi rend="ital">maimed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismembered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disfigured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of some of its parts</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and perh. not ante-Aug.; syn.: mutilus, mancus). </sense><sense id="n49320.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunca manu pinus regit (Polyphemum),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the trunk of a pinetree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunca illa et retorrida manus Mucii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:51" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>trees stripped of their branches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:455" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncas mhonesto vulnere nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus naribus auribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:83:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 83, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of its horn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:42" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem lumina truncam,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of its eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia non habuit, truncoque repandus in undas Corpore desiluit,</quote> <trans><tr>deprived of its limbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 680</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum trunci corporis in agro Romano natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varie ex integris truncos gigni, ex truncis integros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 10, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>broken in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci enses et fractae hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:711" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum lignum, i. e. hasta fracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:251" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 251</bibl></cit>: membra carmae, Ov M. 11, 560; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alnus,</quote> <trans><tr>without oars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:300" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncae atque mutilae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49320.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia trunca pedum,</quote> <trans><tr>without feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 310</bibl></cit>: truncus capitis, Sil 10, 311.—</sense><sense id="n49320.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49320.4" n="1" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">not developed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfect</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wanting in their parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam imperfecta (animalia) suisque Trunca vident numeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:376" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (nanus) jactabat truncas manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 42—</sense><sense id="n49320.5" n="2" level="3"> Of members <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:181" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49320.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">maimed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutilated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Capua) urbs trunca, sine senatu, sine plebe, sine magistratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>without a leader</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:333" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus vero, sine quibus trunca esset actio ac debilis, vix dici potest, quot motus habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunca et debilis medicina (sine rerum naturae cognitione), Cels. praef.: sermo (volucrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:478" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunca quaedam ex Menandro,</quote> <trans><tr>fragments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>:</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49321" type="main" key="truncus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">truncus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bole</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trunk</hi> of a tree (without regard to its branches). </sense><sense id="n49321.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus ... Per truncos ac per ramos diffunditur omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? in arboribus, in quibus non truncus, non rami, non folia sunt denique, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 233</bibl>; Hor S. 1, 8, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 17, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 358</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49321.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49321.3" n="1" level="3"> Of the human body, <hi rend="ital">the trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the body</hi>, apart from the limbs: <cit><quote lang="la">status erectus et celsus, nullā mollitiā cervicum: trunco magis toto se ipse moderans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo illum ex trunco corporis spectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto pugnat se attollere trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 822</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 640</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et caput abscisum calido viventeque trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 654</bibl></cit>: jacet litore truncus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 557</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49321.4" n="2" level="3"> Of a column. </sense><sense id="n49321.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The shaft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49321.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The cubical trunk of a pedestal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the die</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dado</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; cf. Plin. <cb n="TRYG" /> 16, 40, 76, § 201.—</sense><sense id="n49321.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A piece cut off</hi>, as a branch of a tree for <hi rend="ital">an our</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:287" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 287</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">a piece of flesh for smoking (cf. trunculus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49321.8" n="4" level="3"> Like caudex, stipes, and the Engl. <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">blockhead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dunce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dolt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī potest esse in ejusmodi trunco sapientia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam truncus atque stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n49321.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (stirpes aegritudinis) ipso trunco everso omnes eligendae (elidendae, Kühn.) sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
truo: <entryFree id="n49322" type="main" key="tru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = avis onocrotalus: <sense id="n49322.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Caecilius irridens magnitudinem nasi: pro di immortales, unde prorepsit truo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
trusatilis: <entryFree id="n49323" type="main" key="tru_sa_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trūsātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>truso</etym>, <sense id="n49323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">may be pushed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mola,</quote> <trans><tr>a hand-mill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trusito: <entryFree id="n49324" type="hapax" key="tru_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trūsĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to push</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust often</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulum trusitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit> (al. trucidant).</sense></entryFree>
truso: <entryFree id="n49325" type="hapax" key="tru_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trūso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>trudo</etym>, <sense id="n49325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to push often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trusus: <entryFree id="n49326" type="main" key="tru_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of trudo.</entryFree>
trutina: <entryFree id="n49327" type="main" key="tru^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭtĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">truta/nh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n49327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pair of scales</hi> (cf.: lanx, statera). </sense><sense id="n49327.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 180, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex trutinis quae staterae dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49327.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ad ea probanda quae non aurificis staterā, sed quādam populari trutinā examinantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani pensantur eādem Scriptores trutinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā parte in trutinā suspendit Homerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:437" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examenve inprobum in illā castiges trutinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trutinator: <entryFree id="n49328" type="main" key="tru^ti^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭtĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>trutinor</etym>, <sense id="n49328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weigher;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">one who examines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut civilia negotia aequus trutinator examines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Epigr. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trutino: <entryFree id="n49329" type="main" key="tru^ti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭtĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭtĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n49329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [trutina] </sense><sense id="n49329.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> form, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balance</hi> (syn. pensito).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:82" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49329.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 36, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu trutinandus est, cui traduntur examina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49329.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭtĭnā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trux: <entryFree id="n49330" type="main" key="trux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trux</orth>, <itype>ŭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> usually truci, but truce in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 14</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. <foreign lang="greek">tru/c</foreign>, new, unfermented wine; hence, trop.</etym>, <sense id="n49330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.; truculentus, torvus). </sense><sense id="n49330.1" n="I" level="1"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">horridus ac trux tribunus plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catonem oratorem non solum gravem sed interdum etiam trucem esse scimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insectator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 832" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Amazons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 479" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 937" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 937</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 111</bibl></cit>; 8, 297; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 81: Theron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:211" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blattae,</quote> <trans><tr>ravaging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 37, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n49330.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trux audere,</quote> <trans><tr>bold</tr>, <tr>daring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:220" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 220</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49330.3" n="II" level="1"> Of things concrete and abstract: (testudo) aspectu truci, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 3 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi (draconis), Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 107: vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemque vocant aliae vultum rigidumque trucemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltu truci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciesque truces oculique minaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 36, 36, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus, Ov M. 15, 603: classicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truci cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:67" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 6, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per lucos vetustā religione truces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi trux atque violentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> given without examples in Rhemn. Palaem. p. 1369 P.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">trŭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Laud. Virg. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tryblium: <entryFree id="n49331" type="greek" key="trybli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tryblĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tru/blion</foreign>, <sense id="n49331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=120" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 120</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
trychnos: <entryFree id="n49332" type="main" key="trychnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trychnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. strychnos.</entryFree>
tryga: <entryFree id="n49333" type="gloss" key="tryga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tryga</orth> antiqui vinum appellabant. unde trygetus adhuc dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=366" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 366</bibl> Müll. [<foreign lang="greek">tru/c, trughto/s</foreign>].</entryFree>
tryginon: <entryFree id="n49334" type="greek" key="try^gi^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trygĭnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tru/ginon</foreign>, <sense id="n49334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a black</hi> <pb n="1906" /> <cb n="TU" /> <hi rend="ital">coloring matter made from the lees of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trygon: <entryFree id="n49335" type="greek" key="try_go_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trȳgōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trugw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n49335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stingray</hi>: Raia pastinaca, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trygona: <entryFree id="n49336" type="main" key="try_go^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trȳgŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird</hi>, otherwise unknown. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 16, 18, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trypherus: <entryFree id="n49337" type="main" key="Try^phe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tryphĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman skilled in caroing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:137" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tryphon: <entryFree id="n49338" type="main" key="Tryphon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tryphon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n49338.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7</bibl> praef.—</sense><sense id="n49338.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:3" default="NO">38, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:3" default="NO">39, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49338.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Ptolemy Philopator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49338.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A publisher of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> ad Tryph. 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:72:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 72, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:3:4" default="NO">13, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tu: <entryFree id="n49339" type="main" key="tu_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tū</orth> (old form of the <sense id="n49339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> tis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> ted, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 33</bibl> et saep.; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> vestrorum or vostrorum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 85, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 123</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> vostrarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; v. ego <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi> [Sanscr. tva, tvam; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">su/</foreign>; Dor. <foreign lang="greek">tu/</foreign>; Goth. thu; Germ. du; Engl. thou, etc.], <hi rend="ital">thou.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49339.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: nec pol homo quisquam faciet impune animatus Hoc nisi tu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 101 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 422</bibl>: unus erit quem tu tolles in caerula caeli Templa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 66 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi etiam legis Portiae, tu C. Gracchi, tu horum libertatis, tu cujusquam denique hominis popularis mentionem facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dulces amores Sperne puer, neque tu choreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tu sum, tu es ego: uni animi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei te rogandi et tui respondendi mihi (labor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tui videndi est copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mei neque te tui intus puditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tis egeat, quia te careat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi aras. tibi occas, tibi seris, tibi eidem metis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot pondo ted esse censes nudum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.: vosne velit an me regnare era, Fors, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 203 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis quid vostrum Epidamnum curari sibi Velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestri adhortandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istanc tecum conspicio simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulta multum, quae vobiscum fabuler,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49339.2" n="2" level="3"> Emphatic. </sense><sense id="n49339.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Jam tibi cerebrum Dispercutiam, excetra tu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 24 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque postulem abs te, ni ipsa res moneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim illa studia deserui, quibus etiam te incendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si hic sis aliter sentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49339.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. in opp. to another <hi rend="ital">pron. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id mihi da negoti: tu tamen Perge, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an mihi potest quicquam esse molestum quod tibi gratum futurum sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos patriam fugimus... tu, Tityre, lentus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49339.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in second clause of a command, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">solve metus, et tu Trojanos exue caestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 420</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 691</bibl>; 6, 365; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49339.6" n="B" level="2"> With an emphatic -te or -met suffixed (only in the forms tute or tutemet, tibimet, tete, vosmet, and vobismet): o Tite, tute, Tati, tibi tanta, tyranne, tulisti, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 947</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 113 Vahl.): bene mones: tute ipse cunctas, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 469, 25</bibl> (Com. v. 3 Vahl. p. 153): <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Quae ex te audivi: ut urbem maximam Expugnavisses regemque Pterelam tute occideris. <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Egone istuc dixi? <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Tute istic, etiam astante hoc Sosia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:114 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 114 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute ipse his rebus finem praescripsisti, pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utere igitur argumento, Laeli, tute ipse sensus tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tute mihi praecepisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute scis—si modo meministi—me tibi tum dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18</bibl></cit>, a, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor, si cesses, aut te amare cogitat Aut tete amari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi si recta probanti placebis, tum non modo tete viceris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid tibi in tete auxilii est, absumptus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutemet mirabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutemet in culpā cum sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:915" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 915</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutemet a nobis ... quaeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibimet ipse supplicia irroga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1222" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vosmet aiebatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc vosmet ipsi, scio ... haud aliter id dicetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: vos quoque in eā re <cb n="TUBE" /> consilio me adjuvate: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum libentius sequor quam quod vosmet ipsi attuleritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 56, 3</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49339.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49339.8" n="A" level="2"> Tibi, as a <hi rend="ital">dativus ethicus</hi> (cf. Ruddim. II. p. 126, n. 44): <cit><quote lang="la">alter tibi descendit de palatio et aedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce tibi exortus est Isocrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ecce tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 41, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Marius veniet tibi origine parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:854" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vobis ipsorum per biduum militia fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n49339.9" n="B" level="2"> Vos, addressed to one person as a representative of more than one, or with a collective noun in the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, vero, Attice, et praesentem me curā levatis, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid hoc loco vos inter vos, Catule?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:73:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 73, 295</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:31:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 31, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, Romanus exercitus, ne destiteritis impio bello?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 12</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, Gaetulia sueta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:287" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, o Calliope, precor aspirate canenti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you</tr>, <tr>Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 525</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 390</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49339.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> for <hi rend="ital">poss. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores vostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac vestrum frequentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantus consensus vestrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra urbis salutem omniumque vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49339.11" n="D" level="2"> Mea tu, <hi rend="ital">my love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my darling</hi>, in familiar language, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuatim: <entryFree id="n49340" type="hapax" key="tu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tuus</etym>, <sense id="n49340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after your manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccere, jam tuatim facis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 31</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
tuba: <entryFree id="n49341" type="main" key="tu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with tubus, a tube</etym>, <sense id="n49341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trumpet</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a war-trumpet</hi> (straight, while the cornu was curved, Acron ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 23</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n49341.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille arma misit, cornua, tubas, falces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae et signa militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: at tuba terribili sonitu taratantara dixit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 842</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 452 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae utrimque canunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum tubā dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 5 al.</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:20" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tuba directi, non aeris cornua fiexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 750</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:477" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 477</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:12 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 12 al.</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 5</bibl>.—Apart from military purposes, it was used on various occasions, as at religious festivals, games, funerals, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:716" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 716</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:139 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 139 al.</bibl>; cf. tubus, II. A.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:103" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 103</bibl>; cf. Atei. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49341.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49341.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A signal for war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">war</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 28:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 28, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49341.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A loud sound</hi>: nimborum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the roar of thunder</hi>, Claud. gigant. 60.—</sense><sense id="n49341.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sonorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated epic poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:4" default="NO">8, 56, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:64:4" default="NO">10, 64, 4</bibl>; 11, 3, 8; Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 197.—</sense><sense id="n49341.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A lofty style of speaking</hi>, Prud. contr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n49341.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuba belli civilis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exciter</tr>, <tr>author</tr>, <tr>instigator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tubantes: <entryFree id="n49342" type="main" key="Tubantes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tubantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Rhine and the Elbe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 55</bibl> sq.; cf. Ukert, Germ. p. 363.</sense></entryFree>
tubarius: <entryFree id="n49343" type="hapax" key="tu_ba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūbārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tuba</etym>, <sense id="n49343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trumpetmaker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuber: <entryFree id="n49344" type="main" key="tu_ber1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from root tum, tumeo</etym>, <sense id="n49344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberance</hi> on animal bodies, whether natural or caused by disease. </sense><sense id="n49344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubera ... anserino adipe curantur,</quote> <trans><tr>tumors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 12, 33, § 107</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 50, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:139 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 139 al.</bibl>; cf.: colaphis tuber est totum caput, <hi rend="ital">is one boil</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is full of boils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 37</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi uber, ibi tuber,</quote> <trans><tr>there are no roses without thorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 359, 29</bibl></cit>: qui ne tuberibus propriis offendat amicum Postulat, ignoscet verrucis illius, <hi rend="ital">boils ... warts</hi>, for great and slight faults, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 73</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants. </sense><sense id="n49344.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A knob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard excrescence</hi> on wood: <cit><quote lang="la">tuber utrumque arboris ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 43</bibl>. 84, § 231; 25, 8, 54, § 95.—</sense><sense id="n49344.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of mushroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a truffle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moril</hi>, a favorite article of food among the Romans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 11, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerrima verno esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 13, § 37 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:116" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:119" default="NO">5, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:7" default="NO">14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:50:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 50, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49344.5" n="C" level="2"> Tuber terrae. </sense><sense id="n49344.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mole-hill</hi>, as a term of abuse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49344.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Another</hi> <cb n="TUBU" /> <hi rend="ital">name for the</hi> cyclaminon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 67, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49345" type="main" key="tu^ber2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n49345.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of apple-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 42, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49345.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fruit of this tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 14, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:42:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 42, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:43:2" default="NO">13, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuberans: <entryFree id="n49346" type="hapax" key="tu_be^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūbĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. tuber</etym>, <sense id="n49346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swelling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tuberatus: <entryFree id="n49347" type="hapax" key="tu_be^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūbĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with knobs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bosses</hi> = tuberosus: ocreae, Fest. s. v. ocrem, p. 181 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tuberculum: <entryFree id="n49348" type="main" key="tu_bercu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūbercŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bump</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">protuberance; a boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tubercle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gingivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabae,</quote> <trans><tr>an excrescence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 45, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 11, 12, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tubero: <entryFree id="n49349" type="main" key="Tu_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūbĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Aelia; e. g. </sense><sense id="n49349.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Aelius Tubero, <hi rend="ital">a Stoic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an opponent of Tiberius Gracchus</hi>, Cic. brut. 31, 117; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Lael. 11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:101" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:de Or. 3:23:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49349.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Tubero, <hi rend="ital">lieutenant of Q. Cicern in Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49349.3" n="III" level="1"> Q. Aelius Tubero, <hi rend="ital">son of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a relative</hi> (according to some, <hi rend="ital">the brother-in-law</hi>) <hi rend="ital">of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the accuser of Ligarius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuberosus: <entryFree id="n49350" type="main" key="tu_be^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūbĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tuber</etym>, <sense id="n49350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of humps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lumps</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">protuberances</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuberosissima frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tubertus: <entryFree id="n49351" type="main" key="Tu_bertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tūbertus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Postumius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:723" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 723</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tubicen: <entryFree id="n49352" type="main" key="tu^bi^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbĭcen</orth>, <itype>cĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tuba-cano</etym>, <sense id="n49352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trumpeter;</hi> esp. in war: <cit><quote lang="la">cornicines tubicinesque canere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 10</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Afr. 82, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:76:4" default="NO">76, 4</bibl>.—At sacrifices: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 91</bibl></cit> Müll.—At funerals, Atei. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49352.1" n="II" level="1"> Tubicines etiam hi appellantur, qui sacerdotes viri speciosi publice sacra faciunt tubarum lustrandarum gratia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=352" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 352</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tubilustrium: <entryFree id="n49353" type="main" key="tu^bi^lustri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbĭlustrĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbŭlustrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tuba-lustro</etym>, <sense id="n49353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival held on the 23d of March and 23d of May</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the trumpets used at sacrifices were purified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the feast of trumpets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies tubulustrium appellatur, quod eo die in atrio sutorio sacrorum tubae lustrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl></cit> Müll. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:849" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 849</bibl>).—Also <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubilustria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:725" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 725</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=352" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 352</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tubula: <entryFree id="n49354" type="main" key="tu^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tuba</etym>, <sense id="n49354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small trumpet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tubulatio: <entryFree id="n49355" type="main" key="tu^bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tubulus</etym>, <sense id="n49355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollowing into a tube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tubulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl> (al. incumulatio).</sense></entryFree>
tubulatus: <entryFree id="n49356" type="main" key="tu^bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">formed like a pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tubular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tubulated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 61, § 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tubulus: <entryFree id="n49357" type="main" key="tu^bu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tubus</etym>, <sense id="n49357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a water-pipe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49357.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 159</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A smoke - pipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49357.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bar of metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49358" type="main" key="Tu^bu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Hostilia: L. Hostilius Tubulus, <hi rend="ital">a prœtor</hi> A. U. C. 611, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuburcinabundus: <entryFree id="n49359" type="hapax" key="tuburci^na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tuburcĭnābundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tuburchĭn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tuburcinor</etym>, <sense id="n49359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greedily eating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gobbling</hi> (cf. lurcus), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 42</bibl> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
tuburcinor: <entryFree id="n49360" type="main" key="tuburci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tuburcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n49360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat greedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gobble up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi> (syn. voro): <cit><quote lang="la">raptim manducare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 21</bibl></cit> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">de suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 42</bibl></cit>; Titin. and Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">tuburcĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">prandio raptim tuburcinato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 183, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tubus: <entryFree id="n49361" type="main" key="tu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tube.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49361.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, for conducting water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl>.—For wine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl>.—For heating baths, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49361.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49361.3" n="A" level="2"> For tuba, <hi rend="ital">a trumpet used at sacrifices</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=117" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 117</bibl> Müll., and Verr. Kalend. Praenest. s. <pb n="1907" /> <cb n="TUEO" /> 23 Mart. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 386</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n49361.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes viscerum tubos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 61, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tuccetum: <entryFree id="n49362" type="main" key="tucce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tuccētum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sausage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haggis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuceta crassa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit> Schol.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapidissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 192; 9, p. 227; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuccius: <entryFree id="n49363" type="main" key="Tucci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuccĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuccĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n49363.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Tuccius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 41</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49363.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Tuccius Valla, <hi rend="ital">a physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 183</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49363.3" n="III" level="1"> Tuccia, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated vestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuder: <entryFree id="n49364" type="main" key="Tu^der"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭder</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n49364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Tiber</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Todi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:645" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 645</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49364.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭders</orth>, <itype>ertis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tuder; as subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Tuder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:464" default="NO">8, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1228</bibl> and 3726.—</sense><sense id="n49364.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭder-nis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tuder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tudes: <entryFree id="n49365" type="main" key="tu^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (ĭtis, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl> Müll.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root tud, tundo; Sanscr. tud-, to thrust</etym>, <sense id="n49365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mallet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tudites malleos appellant antiqui a tundendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=352 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 352 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.: fabriles operae tudibus contundere massas Festinant, Auct. Aetnae, 659.</sense></entryFree>
tudicius: <entryFree id="n49366" type="main" key="Tudici^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tudicĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Tudicius,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman senator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tudicula: <entryFree id="n49367" type="hapax" key="tu^di^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭdĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tudes</etym>, <sense id="n49367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small machine for bruising olives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tudiculo: <entryFree id="n49368" type="main" key="tu^di^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭdĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tudicula</etym>, <sense id="n49368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir about</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bene ferbuerit, tudiculabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tuditans: <entryFree id="n49369" type="main" key="tu^di^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭdĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tud, tundo], <sense id="n49369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beating often</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n49369.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 394</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1142</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49369.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pushing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">driving on</hi>: tuditantes significat negotium tundentes, id est agentes, Fest. pp. 352 and 353 Müll.: haec inter sese tum (certabant) tuditantes, Enn. ib. (Ann. v. 138 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
tuditanus: <entryFree id="n49370" type="main" key="Tu^di^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŭdĭtānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Sempronia, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl> (Ann. v. 305 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 50 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
