tueo: <entryFree id="n49371" type="main" key="tueo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tueo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. tueor <sense id="n49371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tueor: <entryFree id="n49372" type="main" key="tu^e^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭĕor</orth>, <itype>tuĭtus, 2</itype> (<sense id="n49372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> only post-Aug., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 10</bibl>; collat. form tūtus, in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, rare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:12:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 12, 13</bibl>; but constantly in the <hi rend="ital">P. a.; inf.</hi> parag. tuerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 35</bibl>; collat. form acc. to the 3d conj. <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:151" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuĕris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 300</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:224" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:449" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 449</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 934: tuamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1004</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> tuĕre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 318</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [etym. dub.], orig., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gaze upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view;</hi> hence, pregn., <hi rend="ital">to see</hi> or <hi rend="ital">look to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, etc.: tueri duo significat; unum ab aspectu, unde est Ennii illud: tueor te senex? pro Juppiter! (Trag. v. 225 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">alterum a curando ac tutela, ut cum dicimus bellum tueor et tueri villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 12</bibl></cit> Müll. sq.—Accordingly, </sense><sense id="n49372.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gaze at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, etc. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: specto, adspicio, intueor): quam te post multis tueor tempestatibus, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 407, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">414, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e tenebris, quae sunt in luce, tuemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nil aliud nisi aquam caelumque tuentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1228 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1228 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuendo Terribiles oculos, vultum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 265</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 713</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia dicentem jam dudum aversa tuetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversa tuentibus hircis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerba tuens,</quote> <trans><tr>looking fiercely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 794</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 467</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49372.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multa in terris fieri caeloque tuentur (homines), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1163" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.3" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to look to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, etc. (the predom. class. signif. of the word; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curo, conservo, tutor, protego, defendo): videte, ne ... vobis turpissimum sit, id, quod accepistis, tueri et conservare non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque eis rebus tuendis conservandisque praefuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:63:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 63, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores et instituta vitae resque domesticas ac familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem conjunctionis humanae munifice et aeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: rem et gratiam et <cb n="TUEO" /> auctoritatem suam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 49, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Paulus personam principis civis facile dicendo tuebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam in re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: tuum munus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri et sustinere simulacrum pristinae dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Castoris P. Junius habuit tuendam,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep in good order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassum ut incustoditum nimis et incautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se, vitam corpusque tueri,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep</tr>, <tr>preserve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antea majores copias alere poterat, nunc exiguas vix tueri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ac suos tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex legiones (re suā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum paleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ceteris armis prudentiae tueri atque defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to guard</tr>, <tr>protect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 172</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuemini castra et defendite diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum unius legionis praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oram maritimam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>to cover</tr>, <tr>protect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines suos ab excursionibus et latrociniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum a furibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: mare ab hostibus, Auct. B. Afr. 8, 2.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non parsimoniā tueri potuit contra illius audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberūm nostrorum pueritiam contra inprobitatem magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 47</bibl> (41).—With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri se adversus Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra adversus vim atque injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Philippum tueri Athenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 46, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 23, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem adversus tres cohortes tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:22" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:4" default="NO">43, 3, 4</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verres fortiter et industrie tuitus contra piratas Siciliam dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 35</bibl></cit> (al. tutatus): <cit><quote lang="la">Numidas in omnibus proeliis magis pedes quam arma tuta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 3</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n49372.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭĕo</orth>, ēre: <cit><quote lang="la">censores vectigalia tuento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ROGO PER SVPEROS, QVI ESTIS, OSSA MEA TVEATIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4788</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri in pace a rusticis Romanis alebantur et in bello ab his tuebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 361</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio et operā curatoris tueri debet non solum patrimonium, sed et corpus et salus furiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:10:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas testatoris ex bono et aequo tuebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (prop. well seen to or guarded; hence), <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of danger</hi> (cf. securus, free from fear). </sense><sense id="n49372.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49372.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius res tuta, nullius domus clausa, nullius vita saepta ... contra tuam cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum victis nihil tutum arbitrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec se satis tutum fore arbitratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me biremis praesidio scaphae Tutum per Aegaeos tumultus Aura feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutus bos rura perambulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis locus tam firmum habuit praesidium, ut tutus esset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare tutum praestare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic existimabat tutissimam fore Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:54" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commodior ac tutior receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutum iter et patens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutissima custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio nostro pasci genus esseque tutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:874" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 874</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam consistere tutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutiorem et opulentiorem vitam hominum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: est et fideli tuta silentio Merces, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi> (diff. from certa, definite, certain), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutior at quanto merx est in classe secundā!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est tua tuta voluntas,</quote> <trans><tr>not without danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in audaces non est audacia tuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:544" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externā vi non tutus modo rex, sed invictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tutioris audentiae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: cogitatio tutior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit brevitas illa tutissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum et diadema tutum Deferens uni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that cannot be taken away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: male tutae mentis Orestes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unsound</hi>, = male sanae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 137</bibl>: quicquid habes, age, Depone tutis auribus, qs. <hi rend="ital">carefully guarded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 27, 18</bibl> (cf. the opp.: auris rimosa, id. S. <cb n="TUGU" /> 2, 6, 46).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pars ratium) tuta fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 346</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: tutus ab insidiis inimici, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hospite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a conjuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a bello, id. H. (15) 16, 344: ab omni injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 31, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim tuendam ad omnis repentinos casus tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id, quod ne timeatur fortuna facit, minime tuti sunt homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudinem tutam ad omnes ictus video esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 32, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49372.10" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus venenorum pericula tutum corpus suum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tutiores essent adversus ictus sagittarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci beneficio adversus intemperiem anni tutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quem tutior adversus casus steti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum praesidio tutus adversus hostes esse debuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>abl.</case>: incendio fere tuta est Alexandria, Auct. B. Alex. 1, 3.—</sense><sense id="n49372.11" n="b" level="4"> Tutum est, with a <hi rend="ital">subj. -clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is prudent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is the part of a prudent man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dicere palam parum tutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:47" default="NO">8, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:33" default="NO">10, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o nullis tutum credere blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutius esse arbitrabantur, obsessis viis, commeatu intercluso sine ullo vulnere victoriā potiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:48" default="NO">11, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis tutissimum est, auctores plurimos sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:63" default="NO">3, 6, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.12" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place of safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security: Tr.</hi> Circumspice dum, numquis est, Sermonem nostrum qui aucupet. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Tutum probe est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuta et parvula laudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidum et tuta petentem Trux aper insequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuto ut collocetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in tuto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sitis in tuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tutum eduxi manipulares meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tutum receptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: cautus, prudens): serpit humi tutus nimium timidusque procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutus et intra Spem veniae cautus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nisi vicinas tutus ararit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id suā sponte, apparebat, tuta celeribus consiliis praepositurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriora quam tutiora consilia magis placuere ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 32, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tūtō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">safely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">securely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without danger.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49372.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49372.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Form tute (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">crede huic tute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum tute vivere, qui honeste vivat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute cauteque agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Form tuto (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuto et libere decernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuto sim,</quote> <trans><tr>in security</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuto ab repentino hostium incursu etiam singuli commeare possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49372.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in vadis consisterent tutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutius et facilius receptus daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutius ac facilius id tractatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usitatis tutius utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ubivis tutius quam in meo regno essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49372.18" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49372.19" n="(a)" level="5"> Form tutissime: nam te hic tutissime puto fore, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl>, A.—</sense><sense id="n49372.20" n="(b)" level="5"> Form tutissimo: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere, ubi tutissimo essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 173</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutissimo infunduntur oboli quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tufa: <entryFree id="n49373" type="foreign" key="tu_fa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tūfa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of helmet-crest;</hi> or, acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a kind of military standard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 5</bibl>; cf. Lyd. Magistr. 1, 8 (hence the Fr. <hi rend="ital">toupet</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
tugio: <entryFree id="n49374" type="main" key="Tugi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tugĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jurist in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuguriolum: <entryFree id="n49375" type="main" key="tu^gu^ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭgŭrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tugurium</etym>, <sense id="n49375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cottage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tugurium: <entryFree id="n49376" type="main" key="tu^gu^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭgŭrĭum</orth> (TEGVRIVM and TIGVRIVM in inscrr.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1773</bibl>; and ib. Labus), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n49376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cottage</hi> of shepherds, peasants, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; Afran. and Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=355" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 355</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 9, 14, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO">5, 3</bibl>, ext. 3; 7, 1, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:180" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tuguriunculum: <entryFree id="n49377" type="hapax" key="tu^gu^ri^uncu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭgŭrĭuncŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tugurium</etym>, <sense id="n49377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cottage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Hil. 9</bibl>. <pb n="1908" /> <cb n="TUM" /></sense></entryFree>
tuisco: <entryFree id="n49378" type="main" key="Tuisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tuisco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the progenitor of the Germans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honored by them as a god</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl>; cf. Grimm, Myth. pp. 176 and 318 (2d ed.).</sense></entryFree>
tuitio: <entryFree id="n49379" type="main" key="tu^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tueor, II.</etym>, <sense id="n49379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking care of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guarding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preservation;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi> praetoris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl> pr.; with <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuitio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:23:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:9:9" default="NO">7, 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 46, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 16, 57, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tuitus: <entryFree id="n49380" type="main" key="tu^i^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tueor.</entryFree>
tuli: <entryFree id="n49381" type="main" key="tu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŭli</orth>, v. fero.</entryFree>
tulingi: <entryFree id="n49382" type="main" key="Tulingi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tulingi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Helvetic tribe on the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tullia: <entryFree id="n49383" type="main" key="Tulli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Tullius.</entryFree>
tulliane: <entryFree id="n49384" type="main" key="Tulli^a_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Tullius <sense id="n49384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tullianus: <entryFree id="n49385" type="main" key="Tulli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tullius.</entryFree>
tulliola: <entryFree id="n49386" type="main" key="Tulli^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Tullia</etym>, <sense id="n49386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pet name for</hi> Tullia, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 6</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
tullius: <entryFree id="n49387" type="main" key="Tulli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Esp., </sense><sense id="n49387.1" n="I" level="1"> Servius Tullius, <hi rend="ital">the sixth king of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl> sqq. —</sense><sense id="n49387.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Tullius Cicero, <hi rend="ital">the renowned statesman and orator.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49387.3" n="III" level="1"> Q. Tullius Cicero, <hi rend="ital">his brother.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49387.4" n="IV" level="1"> M. Tullius Tiro, <hi rend="ital">a freedman of M. Cicero.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n49387.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> Tullia, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of king Servius Tullius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Tarquinius Superbus.</hi>—Also, </sense><sense id="n49387.6" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of M. Tullius Cicero.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Tullius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tullian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: Scipio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">introduced in Cicero's</hi> Somnium Scipionis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dungeon of the state-prison in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by king Servius Tullius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=151" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 151</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 22, 10</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 262 sq.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullĭānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of M. Tullius Cicero</hi>: jocari, Aug. contr. Pelag. 2, 10, 37.</sense></entryFree>
tullus: <entryFree id="n49388" type="main" key="Tullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n49388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen</hi>, e.g. Tullus Hostilius, <hi rend="ital">the third king of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:1" default="NO">9, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullus Cluilius,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman ambassador</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 5 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tulo: <entryFree id="n49389" type="main" key="tulo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tulo</orth>, <itype>tĕtŭli</itype> (tŭli), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>akin with tollo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tla/w</foreign></etym>, ante-class. collat. form of fero, <sense id="n49389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lift up</hi>: nisi quid tua facultas nobis tulat opem, peream, Att. ap. Macr. Diff. et Soc. Gr. et Lat. Verb. 6, 14 (Trag. Frag. v. 102 Rib.); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 16</bibl>; and v. fero <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tum: <entryFree id="n49390" type="main" key="tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tum</orth>, <sense id="n49390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. demonstr.</hi>, of time [pronom. demonstr. stems to-, ta-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">to</foreign>, seen in ita, tam, etc.; cf. quom or cum], <hi rend="ital">then.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n49390.2" n="A" level="2"> Referring to a time previously specified. </sense><sense id="n49390.3" n="1" level="3"> To a definite past time. </sense><sense id="n49390.4" n="(a)" level="5"> To a period of time in which something was or happened (opp. later periods) = illis temporibus: <cit><quote lang="la">is dictu'st ollis popularibus olim Qui tum vivebant homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 308" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 308</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tum erat res in pecore et locorum possessionibus, i. e. Romuli temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi male dicerent, quod tum fieri licebat, i. e. Periclis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat omnino tum mos ut faciles essent in suum cuique tribuendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastae tum in his locis solitudines erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 29, 3</bibl>; 4, 6, 12; 42, 62, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 9, 4: ut tum erant tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 4</bibl>; 2, 9, 8; 2, 50, 2; 2, 63, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">39, 6, 7 and 9.—With illis temporibus: nam jam tum illis temporibus fortius ... loquebantur quam pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to a point of time, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at that time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigneita fere tum milia militum octo Duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 336" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 336</bibl></cit> Vahl.: ut jacui exsurgo; <cit><quote lang="la">ardere censui aedis: ita tum confulgebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam duo restabant fata tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 14</bibl>: quot eras annos gnatus tum, quom, etc.? <hi rend="ital">Me</hi> Septuennis, nam tum dentes mihi cadebant primulum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. prol. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 82</bibl>: sic igitur tum se levis ac diffusilis aether ... undique flexit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 467</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:837" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 837</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:911" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 911</bibl>; 5, 432; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 942: atque huic anno proximus Sulla consule et Pompejo fuit. Tum P. Sulpicii in tribunatu, cottidie contionantis, totum genus dicendi cognovimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:306" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 89, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit Eudemum Pheras venisse, quae erat urbs in Thessaliā tum admodum nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl></cit>; id. Rep. <cb n="TUM" /> 2, 37, 63: <cit><quote lang="la">hi tum in Asiā rhetorum principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 61, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tum veritus Caesar Pharum prehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno a Campanis Cumae, quam Graeci tum urbem tenebant, capiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 37, 7: praetores tum duos Latium habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aemilius, cujus tum fasces erant, dictatorem dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 46, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 7, 12: tum Athenis perpetui archontes esse desierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Cimbri et Teutoni transcendere Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non timido, non ignavo cessare tum licuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archiae, qui tum maximum magistratum Thebis obtinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 3, 3</bibl>.—With in eo tempore: eum quem virile secus tum in eo tempore habebat, Asell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl>.—Repeated by anaphora: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nox omnium temporum conjurationis acerrima fuit. Tum Catilinae dies exeundi, tum ceteris manendi condicio, tum descriptio ... constituta est, tum tuus pater, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1377</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1399" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1399</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.6" n="(g)" level="5"> Esp., referring to a former state, implying that it no longer exists: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesivit ex lege illā Corneliā quae tum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sententias Oppianicus, quae tum erat potestas, palam ferri velle dixisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caere, opulento tum oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 52, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores aerarii (nam tum a praetoribus tractabatur aerarium), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.7" n="(d)" level="5"> Expressly opposed to present time (hodie, nunc, hoc tempore, etc.; class. and very freq.; but in post-Aug. writers tunc is regularly used): prius non is eras qui eras; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc is factu's qui tum non eras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nunc tibi Id laudi ducis quod tum fecisti inopiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tabula, tum imperio tuo revulsa, nunc a me tamen reportata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:46:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 46, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum imperator populi Romani deos patrios reportabat, nunc praetor ejusdem populi eosdem illos deos ... auferebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>, § 77; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 35</bibl>, § 78; 2, 5, 20, § 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 22, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 9, 6</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Opposed to another time specified: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque tum eos exire jussit. Post autem e provinciā litteras ad conlegium misit, se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ut tum carere rege, sic pulso Tarquinio nomen regis audire non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut legatorum antea, ita tum novorum colonorum caede imbutis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 22, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 1</bibl>; 2, 52, 7; 4, 2, 10; 4, 57, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">21, 17, 1: et tum sicca, prius celeberrima fontibus, Ide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 11, 7</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In the historians in applying general statements or truths to the state of affairs spoken of: communi enim fit vitio naturae ut invisis atque incognitis rebus ... vehementius exterreamur; <cit><quote lang="la">ut tum accidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera alia aliis legibus, ceterum eodem modo omnia fiunt. Tum ita factum accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 32, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 31, 12</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Denoting coincidence or inner connection with an action before mentioned = a temporal clause (tum = cum hoc fieret), <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tum non ingemuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tum quidem hominum venustatem et facetias perspicere potuisti? i. e. cum coronam auream imponebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: apud imperitos tum illa dicta sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc agendum est subtilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque tum Stajenus condemnatus est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in that trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Porcius Cato qui, asper ingenio, tum lenem mitemque senatorem egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tum supplicia dis ... decernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia tum potuit Priamo quoque flenda videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 474</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With the occasion referred to specified in the same clause: Manlius ... ex petulanti scurrā in discordiis civitatis ad eam columnam tum suffragiis populi pervenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emisti tum in naufragio hujus urbis ... tum, inquam, emisti ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Repeated by anaphora: et Capitolinis injecit sedibus ignes. Tum statua Nattae, tum simulacra deorum, Romulusque et Remus cum altrice beluā vi <cb n="TUM" /> fulminis icti conciderunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so repeated seven times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Redundant, the time of the action being clear without it (esp. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc tum judicio facto ... tamen Avitus Oppianicum reum statim non facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque tum ille inopiā et necessitate coactus ad Caepasios confugit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43, 161</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 51</bibl>, where tum redundant occurs six times successively.—</sense><sense id="n49390.8" n="2" level="3"> In oblique discourse, referring to the time of the speaker, = nunc in direct discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">quando autem se, si tum non sint, pares hostibus fore?</quote> <trans><tr>if they were not now so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dixit Sempronius) ... nec tum agrum plebi, sed sibi invidiam quaeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 44, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 57, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia eos tum transcendere non Italiae modo, sed etiam urbis Romanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 35, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21, 7</bibl> (in this use nunc is also freq.).—</sense><sense id="n49390.9" n="3" level="3"> Referring to indefinite time. </sense><sense id="n49390.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at such a time of the year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">day</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">at such a season</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique tauros in gregem redigo (after Lyra rises),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:35" default="NO">1, 35</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:87" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 87</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With the force of an indefinite temporal clause, <hi rend="ital">at such a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such circumstances</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">when such a thing happens as has happened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (porci) a partu decimo die habentur puri, ab eo appellantur sacres, quod tum ad sacrificium idonei habentur primum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:7:13" default="NO">2, 7, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde cibum sequitur somnus ... quia plurima tum se corpora conturbant (i. e. cum cibum ceperunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 957</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:599" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 599</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:892" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 892</bibl>; 4, 919; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 1030: quam regionem cum superavit animus ... finem altius se efferendi facit. Tum enim sui similem et levitatem et calorem adeptus ... nullam in partem movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23, 55</bibl>; 4, 24, 54; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With the force of a conditional clause, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if so</hi>: immo res omnis relictas habeo prae quod tu velis. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Tum tu igitur, quā causā missus es ad portum, id expedi (i. e. si ita est), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 78</bibl>: non potitus essem; <cit><quote lang="la">fuisset tum illos mi aegre aliquot dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego C. Caesaris laudibus desim, quas, etc.? Tum hercule me confitear non judicium aliquod habuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 39, 93</bibl></cit>: scribant aliquid Isocrateo more ...; <cit><quote lang="la">tum illos existimabo non desperatione formidavisse genus hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 70, 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 21, 49</bibl> (17, 39); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18</bibl> (19), 81: vellem tam ferax saeculum haberemus ...; <cit><quote lang="la">tum ego te primus hortarer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.13" n="4" level="3"> Referring to future time. </sense><sense id="n49390.14" n="(a)" level="5"> To a definite time before mentioned: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sit satius perdere Quam aut nunc manere tam diu, aut tum persequi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after my future return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nunc mente prospicio quae tum studia hominum, qui concursus futuri sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caecin. 13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecin. 13, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum meae ... Vocis accedet bona pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With the force of a conditional clause (cf. 3. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra), <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in this instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if so</hi>: specta, tum scies. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 100</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quom videbis, tum scies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: tuom incendes genus; <cit><quote lang="la">Tum igitur aquae erit tibi cupido, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confer sudantes, ructantes, refertos epulis ... tum intelleges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, dictatorem creemus ... Pulset tum mihi lictorem qui sciet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">71, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 22, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.16" n="B" level="2"> Referring to a time subsequent to a time mentioned, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.17" n="1" level="3"> Simple sequence in time. </sense><sense id="n49390.18" n="(a)" level="5"> Time proper (only of an immediate sequence; <cit><quote lang="la">otherwise deinde, postea, etc., are used): tum cum corde suo divum pater atque hominum rex Effatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:179" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico ei quo pactod eam viderim erilem nostram filiam sustollere. Extimuit tum illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 58</bibl>: tum ille egens forte adplicat Primum ad Chrysidis patrem se. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48</bibl> (49); 135 (136); so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 112</bibl> (113): equos quinto anno ... amittere binos (dentes); <cit><quote lang="la">tum renascentes eis sexto anno impleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: collo <pb n="1909" /> <cb n="TUM" /> cari jussit hominem in aureo lecto, abacosque complures ornavit ... Tum ad mensam eximiā formā pueros jussit consistere, eosque, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerat hoc ille, cum puer nuntiavit venire ad eum Laelium ... Tum Scipio e cubiculo est egressus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 66, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes suos ab oppugnatione reduxerunt. Tum suo more conclamaverunt ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 64</bibl>; 5, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 48: adsurgentem ibi regem cuspide ad terram adfixit. Tum spolia caputque abscisum spiculo gerens ... hostes fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 26, 9</bibl>; 1, 18, 10; 1, 20, 1; 1, 22, 6; 1, 28, 4; 1, 28, 9; 2, 24, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 8, 11, etc.: tum Caesar cum exercitu Thessaliam petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 121</bibl>; 10, 481; 14, 386; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:19:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:5" default="NO">1, 23, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.19" n="(b)" level="5"> In partic., foll. by an <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum, prope jam perculsis aliis tribunis, A. Verginius Caesoni capitis diem dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum omni spe perditā, Meherdates dolo ejus vincitur, traditurque victori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum, ferro extracto, confestim exanimatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.20" n="(g)" level="5"> Implying a connection between two events, <hi rend="ital">hence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under these circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at pater omnipotens irā tum percitus acri ... Phaëthonta ... Deturbavit in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madefactum iri Graeciam sanguine ... tum neque te ipsum non esse commotum, Marcumque Varronem et M. Catonem ... vehementer esse perterritos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 49</bibl>; 5, 51; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 59: quippe quibus nec domi spes prolis, nec cum finitimis conubia essent. Tum ex consilio patrum Romulus legatos circa vicinas gentes misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 31, 7</bibl>; 4, 45, 7.—</sense><sense id="n49390.21" n="2" level="3"> Enumeration of a series of events; the co-ordinate clauses introduced by tum ... tum, or primum (primo) ... deinde ... tum, etc. </sense><sense id="n49390.22" n="(a)" level="5"> Succession of time proper: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem Hannibali unum e concilio datum (a Jove), tum ei ducem illum praecepisse ne respiceret, illum autem respexisse, tum visam beluam vastam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 58</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... deinde ... tum ... tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ... deinde ... tum ... postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 6</bibl>: primum colonos inde Romanos expulit: inde in Latinam viam transgressus, etc., inde Lavinium recepit; tum deinceps Corbionem, Vitelliam; <cit><quote lang="la">postremum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primi consules sub jugum missi, tum ut quisque gradu proximus erat, tum deinceps singulae legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo ... deinde ... tum ... tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 22, 8</bibl></cit>; id. praef. 9; 3, 28, 8: 5, 39, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">23, 23, 6: deinde ... deinde ... Tum ... post quas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: primum ... deinde ... deinde ... tum ... postea, Masur. Gabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:60" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.23" n="(b)" level="5"> So in partic.: tum (also hic, et; <cit><quote lang="la">not deinde or postea), to denote the succession of speakers in dialogue: immo duas dabo, inquit adulescens ... Tum senex ille: Si vis, inquit, quattuor sane dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 46</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Piso ... inquit, etc. Tum Quintus ... inquit, etc. Hic ego ... inquam, etc. Tum ille ... inquit, etc. Tum Piso ... inquit, etc. Et ille ridens ... inquit, etc. Tum Piso exorsus est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Atticus ... inquit, etc. Tum ille ... inquit, etc. Tum Brutus, etc. Tum ille, etc. Tum Atticus, etc. Tum Pomponius ... inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 11</bibl></cit> sqq., and through the whole treatise; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 13</bibl>; 1, 12, 43 and 44; 2, 19, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
