D. 1, 6, 15</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 19</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 2</bibl> sqq.; 23, 12, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>; 42; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl> sqq.; 18, 1, 9 sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 594</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.24" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sequence or succession of thought, passing into mere co-ordination (v. C. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b, g</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">then ... again ... furthermore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mi in cursu obstiterit, faxo vitae is obstiterit suae. Prius edico ne quis, etc. Tum pistores scrofipasci qui, etc. Tum piscatores .... Tum lanii autem qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 39</bibl>: (res familiaris) primum bene parta sit, tum quam plurimis se utilem praebeat, deinde augeatur ratione, diligentia,<cb n="TUM" />  etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.25" n="C" level="2"> Hence, as co-ordinating conjunction, introducing an additional assertion, or thought. </sense><sense id="n49390.26" n="1" level="3"> Alone, = praeterea, <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi> (freq. in ante-class. style and in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">rare in Livy and post-Aug. prose): argenti aurique advexit multum, lanam purpuramque multam ... tum Babylonica peristromata, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. prol. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 680</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 494</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1152" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum ingenium L. Luculli, magnumque optimarum artium studium, tum omnis ab eo percepta doctrina ... caruit omnino rebus urbanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterā ex parte Bellovaci instabant, alteram Camulogenus tenebat: tum legiones a praesidio interclusas maximum flumen distinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl>: naves convenerunt duae Punicae quinqueremes; <cit><quote lang="la">duae ab Heracleā triremes ... tum quinque Rhodiae quadriremes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 56, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl>.—Sometimes connecting two terms of the same clause, with the force of cum ... tum (v. infra, 3. d.): <cit><quote lang="la">quot me censes homines jam deverberasse, hospites tum civis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciendum est igitur nobis ut ... veteranorum, tum legionis Martiae quartaeque consensus ... confirmetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 1</bibl> (in co-ordination often with etiam, autem, and sometimes with praeterea and porro; v. III. infra).—</sense><sense id="n49390.27" n="2" level="3"> Tum as correlative of a preceding tum. </sense><sense id="n49390.28" n="(a)" level="5"> With an added assertion or thought: ita est haec hominum natio: voluptarii atque potatores, Tum sycophantae ... plurimi In urbe habitant; <cit><quote lang="la">tum meretrices mulieres Nusquam perhibentur blandiores gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.29" n="(b)" level="5"> Tum ... tum = nunc ... nunc (modo ... modo), <hi rend="ital">sometimes ... sometimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now ... now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one time ... at another</hi> (freq. in Cic., not in Cæs., rare in Liv., and very rare in postAug. writers): <cit><quote lang="la">tum huc, tum illuc inretitos impedit piscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum hoc mihi probabilius, tum illud videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ... tum hoc tum illud probabilius videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(alvus) tum restringitur, tum relaxatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 13</bibl> (14), 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:37:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 37, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator tum appellare tum adhortari milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl>.—Tum may be repeated several times: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique propter voluptatem tum in morbos graves, tum in damna, tum in dedecora incurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so three times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:45:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 25, 96</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">four times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 39, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 75</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">five times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 94</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">six times,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">seven times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 133</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">nine times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 51</bibl></cit>.—And in chronological order (to be distinguished from the instances B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensium (rem publicam constituerunt) tum Theseus, tum Draco, tum Solo, tum Clisthenes, tum multi alii,</quote> <trans><tr>at different times</tr>, <tr>successively</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.30" n="(g)" level="5"> Preceded or followed by other co-ordinate words (alias, modo, aliquando, aut ... aut, nunc ... nunc): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegitur qualis ille sit quem tum moderatum, alias modestum, tum temperantem, alias constantem continentemque dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ... tum ... aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ... tum ... aut ... aut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 61, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... tum autem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ... nunc ... tum ... tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.31" n="(d)" level="5"> Tum ... tum = et ... et, <hi rend="ital">both ... and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not only ... but also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partly ... partly</hi>, without regard to time, the second term being frequently <cb n="TUM" /> strengthened by etiam (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Milo Compsam oppugnans, ictusque lapide tum Clodio, tum patriae, quam armis petebat, poenas dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Muciam et Fulviam, tum a patre, tum a viro utramque inclitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Pompejo tum proprias, tum etiam filiae lacrimas reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl>; Nep. praef. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">and with etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:9:1" default="NO">5, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6" default="NO">7, 6</bibl> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.32" n="3" level="3"> As correlative with a preceding cum, introducing particular after a universal or a stronger or more important assertion after a weaker or less important. </sense><sense id="n49390.33" n="a" level="4"> Connecting complete sentences with different predicates, cum ... tum = <hi rend="ital">as ... so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while ...</hi> (tum being not translated; ante-class. cum always with <hi rend="ital">indic.;</hi> class. with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quom antehac te amavi, et mihi amicam esse crevi ... tum id mihi hodie aperuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom id mihi placebat, tum uno ore omnes omnia Bona dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum res tota ficta sit pueriliter, tum ne efficit quidem quod vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 16, 1</bibl>; and so with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 250</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnium rerum simulatio est vitiosa, tum amicitiae repugnat maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl>; and so with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum merito ejus fieri intellegebat, tum magni interesse arbitrabatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 53, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.34" n="b" level="4"> Clauses with the same predicate, which is placed after the first clause (always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi, cum multa eximie divineque videntur Athenae tuae peperisse, tum nihil melius illis mysteriis quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 46, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.35" n="c" level="4"> Clauses with a common predicate placed before both co-ordinate terms, cum ... tum = <hi rend="ital">not only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but also; as ... so especially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visa est Arcesilae cum vera sententia, tum honesta et digna sapiente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">movit patres conscriptos cum causa tum auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49390.36" n="d" level="4"> With a common predicate after both co-ordinate terms: <cit><quote lang="la">quom virum tum uxorem, di vos perdant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria cum omni aetati turpis tum senectuti foedissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:34:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 34, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitatos animos flecti quam frangi putabat cum tutius tum facilius esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 57, 1</bibl>; 10, 26, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 5</bibl>.—With tum several times repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">quem pater moriens cum tutoribus et propinquis, tum legibus, tum aequitati magistratuum, tum judiciis vestris commendatum putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 151</bibl></cit>; cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49390.37" n="e" level="4"> Tum, in this construction, is freq. strengthened, </sense><sense id="n49390.38" n="(a)" level="5"> By vero: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec sunt videnda, tum vero illud est hominis magni, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in particular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:58:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 58, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:23:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 23, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.39" n="(b)" level="5"> By maxime, <hi rend="ital">above all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnibus in rebus temeritas in adsentando turpis est, tum in eo loco maxime in quo ju dicandum est quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum infamia atque indignitas rei impediebat, tum maxime quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.40" n="(g)" level="5"> By praecipue, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnium sociorum provinciarumque rationem diligenter habere debetis, tum praecipue Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna quae plurimum potest cum in reliquis rebus, tum praecipue in bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 43, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:13" default="NO">1, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:106" default="NO">5, 10, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.41" n="(d)" level="5"> By inprimis, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa non probo, tum illud inprimis quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 22, 3</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) By cumprimis, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>: quapropter bene cum superis de rebus habenda Nobis est ratio ... tum cumprimis Unde anima atque animi constet<pb n="1910" /> <cb n="TUM" />  natura videndum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 131</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) By certe, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at cum de plurimis eadem dicit, tum certe de maximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) By nimirum, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undoubtedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plurimas ... commoditates amicitia contineat, tum illa nimirum praestat omnibus quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 7, 23</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) By etiam, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes omnibus ex terris homines improbos audacesque collegerat, tum etiam multos fortes viros et bonos ... tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tu cum memoriter, tum etiam erga nos amice et benevole collegisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suā virtute, tum etiam alienis vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 23, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 23, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 32, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:10" default="NO">3, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:6:3" default="NO">9, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:143" default="NO">9, 4, 143</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) By quoque, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum potestas major, tum vir quoque potestati par hostes trans Anienem submovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 22, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 72</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) By et, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus mortem cum luctus civitatis, tum et dictaturae undecim insignem fecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) By praeterea, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicimus C. Verrem cum multa libidinose fecerit, tum praeterea quadringentiens sestertium ex Siciliā abstulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n49390.42" n="II" level="1"> Tum as correlative of dependent clauses (freq. in ante - class. writings and Cic., rare in post-Aug. writings). </sense><sense id="n49390.43" n="A" level="2"> With temporal clauses, introduced by <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">at the time when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a time when.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.44" n="1" level="3"> Referring to definite past time. </sense><sense id="n49390.45" n="a" level="4"> Tum as antecedent of cum: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum cum primum jussit me ad se arcessier, Roget quis, Quid tibi cum illā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Hercules) tum dolore frangebatur cum immortalitatem ipsā morte quaerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene apud majores nostros senatus tum cum florebat imperium decrevit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 33, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 24, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum mittendos legatos fuisse cum Perseus Graecas urbes obsideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum cum Vipereos sparsi ... dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 572</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl>.—After <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tum cum in Asiā res magnas permulti amiserant scimus Romae solutione impeditā fidem concidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:15" default="NO">2, 8, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Tum inserted in the temporal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Davo egomet vidi jurgantem ancillam ... quom ibi me adesse neuter tum praesenserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.46" n="b" level="4"> Tum, introducing the apodosis of the temporal clause (generally not transl. in Engl.). </sense><sense id="n49390.47" n="(a)" level="5"> Of coincident events, cum ... tum = <hi rend="ital">while</hi>: quom genui tum morituros scivi, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 361 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum minime videbamur, tum maxime philosophabamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pavida mulier nullam opem videret, tum Tarquinius fateri amorem, orare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 11, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49390.48" n="(b)" level="5"> Tum = deinde, usu. after a <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cum Sulla fecisset, tum ante oppidum Nolam Samnitium castra cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:319" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 92, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 22, 4</bibl>.—Inserted in the apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam humanae opes egestae a Veis essent, amoliri tum deum dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.49" n="2" level="3"> Referring to definite present time: <cit><quote lang="la">quem esse negas, eundem esse dicis. Cum enim miserum esse dicis, tum eum qui non sit, dicis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.50" n="3" level="3"> Referring to indefinite time. </sense><sense id="n49390.51" n="a" level="4"> As antecedent of the clause, = <hi rend="ital">at the time when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a time when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>: hominum inmortalis est infamia; <cit><quote lang="la">etiam tum vivit quom esse credas mortuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sibi enim quisquam tum se vitamque requirit Cum pariter mens et corpus sopita quiescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 919</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:444" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:455" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 455</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 1166: omnis praedictio mali tum probatur cum ad praedictionem cautio adjungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl>: tum cum sine pondere suci Mobilibus ventis arida facta volant, <cb n="TUM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 26, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 93</bibl>.—Tum maxime ... cum plurimum = eo magis quo magis: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (partem animi) tum maxime vigere cum plurimum absit a corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 70</bibl></cit>; so, cum maxime ... tum maxime; v. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> foll.—</sense><sense id="n49390.52" n="b" level="4"> Tum introducing the apodosis. </sense><sense id="n49390.53" n="(a)" level="5"> As coincident: <cit><quote lang="la">quom amamus, tum perimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus, cum folia cadunt, tum iterum tempestiva est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 155</bibl> (156): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea quae quasi involuta fuerunt, aperti sunt, tum inventa dicuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl>.—Cum maxime ... tum maxime = quo magis eo magis: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quom pugnabant maxume, ego tum fugiebam maxume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem omnes, cum secundae res sunt maxume, tum maxume Meditari secum oportet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 30</bibl></cit> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>—</sense><sense id="n49390.54" n="(b)" level="5"> As subsequent: <cit><quote lang="la">ad legionem quom itum, adminiculum eis danunt tum jam aliquem cognatum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo cum accessit ratio argumentique conclusio ... tum et perceptio eorum omnium apparet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 41, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.55" n="4" level="3"> Referring to future time. </sense><sense id="n49390.56" n="(a)" level="5"> Tum as antecedent of cum: <cit><quote lang="la">quom mi haec dicentur dicta, tum tu, furcifer, quasi mus in medio pariete vorsabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non committam ut tum haec res judicetur cum haec frequentia Romā discesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 22, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 651</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.57" n="(b)" level="5"> Tum introducing the apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">quom videbis, tum scies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo cum perpauca dixero, tum ad jus civile veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.58" n="B" level="2"> With temporal clause, introduced by <hi rend="ital">ubi.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.59" n="1" level="3"> Tum as antecedent of the clause (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitem novellam resecare tum erit tempus ubi valebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum tu igitur demum id adulescenti aurum dabis, ubi erit locata virgo in matrimonium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.60" n="2" level="3"> Tum introducing the apodosis. </sense><sense id="n49390.61" n="(a)" level="5"> Referring to definite past time (tum always = deinde): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi eorum dolorem majorem quam ceterorum cognovi, tum meum animum in illos, tum mei consilii causam proposui, tum eos hortatus sum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:63:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 63, § 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illuxit, et Romanis Punica et Gallica arma cognita, tum dubitationem exemere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 57, 3</bibl>; 9, 43, 16; 21, 25, 12; 23, 11, 4.—</sense><sense id="n49390.62" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to indefinite time: <cit><quote lang="la">post ubi tempust promissa jam perfici, Tum coacti necessario se aperiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam morbi se flexit causa ... Tum quasi vaccillans primum consurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 503</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:526" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 526</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.63" n="(g)" level="5"> Referring to future time: <cit><quote lang="la">otium ubi erit, tum tibi operam ludo et deliciae dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu voles, Ubi tempus erit, sat habet si tum recipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ubi id interrogando argumentis firmavero, tum testes ad crimen accommodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi haerere jam aciem videris, tum terrorem equestrem infer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 55, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.64" n="C" level="2"> With a temporal clause introduced by <hi rend="ital">postquam.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.65" n="1" level="3"> Tum as antecedent of the clause (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Flaminius qui ne quieto quidem hoste ipse quieturus erat, tum vero postquam res sociorum ante oculos prope suos ferri vidit, suum id dedecus ratus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl> (v. infra, III. A. 2. a. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n49390.66" n="2" level="3"> Tum introducing the apodosis (always = deinde). </sense><sense id="n49390.67" n="(a)" level="5"> Referring to definite past time: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam e portu piratae exierunt, tum coeperunt quaerere homines, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:84:1" default="NO" valid="yes">84, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 51, 40</bibl> (al. tunc): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam satis virium collectum videbat, tum ex suis unum sciscitatum Romam ad patrem misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 66, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13, 4</bibl>; 22, 48, 4; 25, 10, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.68" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to indefinite time: postquam vero commoditas quaedam ... dicendi copiam consecuta est, tum ingenio freta malitiā <cb n="TUM" /> pervertere urbes adsuevit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.69" n="D" level="2"> With a temporal clause introduced by <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.70" n="1" level="3"> Tum as antecedent of the clause (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero ingentem gemitum dat Ut spolia, ut currus, utque ipsum corpus amici ... conspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 485</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 218</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.71" n="2" level="3"> Tum introducing the apodosis. </sense><sense id="n49390.72" n="(a)" level="5"> Of definite past time: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ut dudum adcurrimus ad Alcesimarchum ... tum mi, puto, prae timore hic excidisse Cistellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ut intellectum est quantam vim haberet accurata ... oratio, tum etiam magistri dicendi multi subito exstiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 44, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 54, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 34, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.73" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to future time: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ut quaeque res delata ad nos erit, tum denique scrutari locos debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditum esse ut quando aqua Albana abundasset, tum, si eam Romanus rite emisisset, victoriam de Vejentibus dari (= si quando),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n49390.74" n="E" level="2"> With a temporal clause introduced by <hi rend="ital">quando.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.75" n="1" level="3"> Tum as antecedent of the clause. </sense><sense id="n49390.76" n="(a)" level="5"> Of definite past time: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem senatūs exstare sentio, tum, quando Alexandro mortuo, legatos Tyrum misimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.77" n="(b)" level="5"> Of future time: <cit><quote lang="la">at scire tum memento quando id quod voles habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam tum essem natus quando Romani dona accipere coepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.78" n="2" level="3"> Tum introducing the apodosis. </sense><sense id="n49390.79" n="(a)" level="5"> Of indefinite time (quando = <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quando esurio tum crepant (intestina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando mulier dotem marito dabat, tum quae ex suis bonis retinebat reciperare dicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl> (6), 14, 4.—</sense><sense id="n49390.80" n="(b)" level="5"> Of future time: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu, quando habebis, tum dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ab eādem parte sol eodemque tempore iterum defecerit, tum signis omnibus ad principium revocatis, expletum annum habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando mihi usus venerit, tum quaeram ex te atque discam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 17, 4.—</sense><sense id="n49390.81" n="F" level="1"> In the apodosis after <hi rend="ital">simul ac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an simul ac nubes successere, ipse in eas tum Descendit (Juppiter), prope ut hinc teli determinet ictus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 402</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.82" n="G" level="1"> With a temporal clause introduced by <hi rend="ital">dum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.83" n="1" level="3"> Tum as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctius visum est nomen Augusti, ut scilicet jam tum dum colit terras, ipso numine ac titulo consecretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:33:66" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 33, 66</bibl></cit> (4, 12, 66).—</sense><sense id="n49390.84" n="2" level="3"> Tum introducing the apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">dum habeat, tum amet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se glomerant ... tum pondere turris Procubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 540</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.85" n="H" level="1"> As antecedent of <hi rend="ital">quamdiu</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum tibi amicus non modo tum fuerit quamdiu tecum in provinciā fuerit, verum etiam nunc sit cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:24:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 24, § 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.86" n="K" level="1"> Denoting a logical consequence after <hi rend="ital">quando</hi> and <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ergo erga te benignus fui ... tum te mihi benigne itidem addecet ... referre gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnus numerus deesset, tum iste homo nefarius in eorum locum ... substituere coepit cives Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.87" n="L" level="1"> After relative clauses denoting time: quā tempestate Paris Helenam innuptis junxit nuptiis, Ego tum gravida expletis jam fere ad pariendum mensibus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 219</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 246 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n49390.88" n="M" level="1"> With conditional clauses. </sense><sense id="n49390.89" n="1" level="3"> With a conditional clause introduced by <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ni</hi> (not nisi). </sense><sense id="n49390.90" n="(a)" level="5"> Tum as antecedent of clause: <cit><quote lang="la">tum pol ego interii, homo si ille abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tenuis causa est, tum etiam argumentandi tenue filum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero ego nequiquam Capitolium servaverim si civem in servitutem duci videam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 14, 4</bibl>; 7, 34, 14; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:1" default="NO">4, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:21" default="NO">14, 2, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.91" n="(b)" level="5"> Tum introducing the apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">si triduum hoc hic erimus, tum arbores in te cadent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 48</bibl> (39); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si, ut spero, cepero, tum vero litteras publice mittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl>: id. <pb n="1911" /> <cb n="TUM" /> Rosc. Am. 49, 142: <cit><quote lang="la">si dimicandum erit, tum tu in novissimos te recipito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 32</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., denoting the consequences of perjury in ancient formulas of oaths: si ego injuste illos homines dedier mihi exposco, tum patriae compotem me numquam sīris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:11" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 53, 11</bibl>; hence, quid si falles? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Tum Mercurius Sosiae iratus siet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 50</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 64, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.92" n="2" level="3"> With a condition contrary to fact. </sense><sense id="n49390.93" n="(a)" level="5"> Tum, antecedent of clause: <cit><quote lang="la">tum esset ostentum, si anguem vectis circumplicavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:68:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 68, § 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum id audirem si tibi soli viveres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 73</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.94" n="(b)" level="5"> Tum introducing the apodosis: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem me amaret, tum istuc prodesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi omnia nobis quae ad victum pertinent. suppeditarentur, tum optimo quisque ingenio, totum se in cognitione et scientiā collocaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 158</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49390.95" n="N" level="1"> After an <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.96" n="1" level="3"> With perfect participles (= postquam or cum ... tum), mostly with <hi rend="ital">denique</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49390.97" n="(a)" level="5"> Referring to definite past time: <cit><quote lang="la">ut morte ejus nuntiatā tum denique bellum confectum arbitraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed confecto proelio tum vero cerneres quanta vis animi fuisset in exercitu Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita rebus divinis peractis tum de bello deque republicā dictator rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 29, 3</bibl>; 3, 56, 1; 5, 50, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 20, 22, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.98" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to indefinite time: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce omnibus rebus consideratis, tum denique id quod primum est dicendum, postremum soleo cogitare, quo utar exordio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:77:315" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 77, 315</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.99" n="(g)" level="5"> Referring to future time (the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> = a <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ita prope XL. diebus interpositis tum denique se responsuros esse arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:Fragm. 10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. Fragm. 10, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.100" n="2" level="3"> With pres. participles (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tacentibus cunctis, tum ipse (dixit), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n49390.101" n="III" level="1"> Particular connections. </sense><sense id="n49390.102" n="A" level="2"> With other particles of time. </sense><sense id="n49390.103" n="1" level="3"> Jam tum, <hi rend="ital">already at that time</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">earlier than might be anticipated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum erat suspitio Dolo malo haec fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe etenim jam tum divom mortalia saecla Egregias animo facies vigilante videbant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1037" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1037</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi jam tum divinasse ille (Romulus) videatur hanc urbem sedem aliquando summo esse imperio praebituram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum in Palatio monte Lupercal hoc fuisse ludicrum ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 41, 7</bibl>; 10, 21, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">24, 49, 1: ut jam tum qualis futurus esset ostenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.104" n="2" level="3"> Tum demum and tum denique, <hi rend="ital">then only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not till then</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">later than might be expected</hi>, implying delayed action. </sense><sense id="n49390.105" n="a" level="4"> Tum demum. </sense><sense id="n49390.106" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversisque in rebus noscere qui sit. Nam verae voces tum demum pectore ab imo Eiciuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demum Liscus, oratione Caesaris adductus, quod antea tacuerat proponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ante in campum degressi sunt quam, etc. Tum demum castra Etruscorum pro moenibus Fidenarum posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 20, 11</bibl>; 5, 39, 2; 23, 19, 15 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:4" default="NO">1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.107" n="(b)" level="5"> In partic., referring to clauses introduced by <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> (v. II. A. B. L. M.), denoting absolute restriction to the terms of the clause: <cit><quote lang="la">imo etiam ubi expolivero, magis hoc tum demum dices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demum mihi procax Academia videbitur si aut consenserint omnes, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is Casilini eo die mansurum dixisset, tum demum cognitus est error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 115, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:4" default="NO">7, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.108" n="(g)" level="5"> Sometimes = nunc demum (anteclass.): victus es, Chaline. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Tum nos demum vivere. Olympio. Gaudeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.109" n="b" level="4"> Tum denique. </sense><sense id="n49390.110" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique tauros in gregem redigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injectā glaebā tumulus is (locus) ubi humatus est vocatur, ac tum denique multa religiosa jura complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 61</bibl>: nequiquam temptati ut tum denique <cb n="TUM" /> desisterent impediendo bello, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 519</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 857</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 664</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.111" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to clauses with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, etc. (v. II. A. B. L. M.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique homines nostra intellegimus bona quom quae in potestate habuimus ea amisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cum venerimus, tum denique vivemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicandum primum fuisse, dein petendum praesidium, postremo ni impetraretur, tum denique querendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 43, 2</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 29, § 126</bibl> (for tum vero denique after <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl>, v. II. D. 2. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n49390.112" n="3" level="3"> Tum primum (rarely primo), <hi rend="ital">then for the first time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum genus humanum primum mollescere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1014" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1014</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum gratiā quos tum primum anniversarios in circo facere constituisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponte sublicio tum primum in Tiberi facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 22, 2</bibl>; 2, 20, 6; 39, 49, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 26</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49390.113" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">deinde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postea</hi>, with consecutive force emphatic. </sense><sense id="n49390.114" n="a" level="4"> Deinde tum (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">primum ea quae sumus acturi cogitare debemus, deinde tum dicere ac facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L.
