L. 6:6:62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 6, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.115" n="b" level="4"> Tum deinde. </sense><sense id="n49390.116" n="(a)" level="5"> = tum demum or tum denique, <hi rend="ital">then at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not till then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne optime patronus occurrat prius conviciis luxuriae, etc., tum deinde narret de bonis Pallae? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:11" default="NO">12, 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emam, aedificabo, credam, exigam, honores geram: tum deinde lassam senectutem in otium referam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 95, § 251</bibl>.—So corresp. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas cum solus pertulisset, tum deinde comitia collegae subrogando habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit> (Weissenb. demum, by conj.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49390.117" n="(b)" level="5"> = an emphatic deinde: nam praetermisit quod in primā parte sumere debuit; <cit><quote lang="la">tum deinde eodem ipso quod omiserat quasi proposito ad confirmandum aliud utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24" default="NO">13, 24</bibl> (23), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 19</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.118" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">hic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tum repente Pacilius quidam accedit, ait, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ego tum ad respondendum surrexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tum injectus est hominibus scrupulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.119" n="d" level="4"> Tum postea: <cit><quote lang="la">tum postea complorantibus nostris, dies quidem tandem inluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 10</bibl> (for quid tum postea, v. D. 1.).—</sense><sense id="n49390.120" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">interim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum, alterum, tertium annum Sassia quiescebat ... Tum interim, Q. Hortensio, Q. Metello coss. ... despondet ei filiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.121" n="B" level="2"> With particles of emphasis. </sense><sense id="n49390.122" n="1" level="3"> Tum vero (sometimes tum enimvero or enimvero tum), <hi rend="ital">then indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at that crisis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then if not before</hi>, etc., or merely = emphatic <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, denoting either coincidence or sequence of action. </sense><sense id="n49390.123" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">discedit a Melino Cluentia. Tum vero illa egregia mater palam exsultare ... coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper equidem magno cum metu incipio dicere ... tum vero ita sum perturbatus ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero dubitandum non existimavit quin ad eos proficisceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aruns Tarquinius et Tullia minor ... junguntur nuptiis. Tum vero in dies infestior Tulli senectus ... coepit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:13" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 49, 13</bibl>; 10, 19, 12; 21, 45, 9; 21, 58, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 685</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:5" default="NO">3, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl>.—And in enumerations: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ... post autem ... tum vero ipsam veterem Karthaginem vendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.124" n="(b)" level="5"> As correlative of temporal or conditional clauses, and after <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubi Romam est nuntiatum, senatui metum injecit ne tum vero sustineri nec in urbe seditio, nec in castris posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero ... si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 4</bibl> (v. II. M. 1. <foreign lang="greek">a, b</foreign>).—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae postquam frustra temptata rogumque parari ... vidit, Tum vero gemitus ... Edidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 621</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:84:1" default="NO" valid="yes">84, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 51, 40</bibl>; v. C. 1. b. (so, tum vero denique after <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl>; v. II. D. 2. and M. 1.).—</sense><sense id="n49390.125" n="2" level="3"> Tum quidem, <hi rend="ital">at that time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then at least</hi> (usu. opposed to a later time): dixit sibi in somnis visum esse, etc. Et tum quidem incolumis exercitum liberavit; post triennium <cb n="TUM" /> autem devovit se, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 51</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">actum quidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 25, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tum quidem ab Dio Perseus in interiora regni recepit se ... post dies paucos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 57, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 17, 3.—Often in resuming the narrative after a digression: ac tum quidem regem ... filium appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—Merely emphatic: <cit><quote lang="la">Duillio Cornelioque coss. etiam mari congredi ausus est. Tum quidem ipsa velocitas classis comparatae victoriae auspicium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit> (2, 2), 7; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 22</bibl> (2, 6), 20; 1, 40 (3, 5), 12.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.126" n="3" level="3"> Ne tum quidem, <hi rend="ital">not even then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quis horum miser hodie? Ne tum quidem, post spiritum extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:40:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 40, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ne tum quidem eos prodire intellexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 18</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vere ne tum quidem miser cum ab Oroete in crucem actus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:23:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl>; Liv. praef. 12; 39, 39, 11.—</sense><sense id="n49390.127" n="4" level="3"> Tum maxime (sometimes tum cummaxime). </sense><sense id="n49390.128" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Especially at that time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly then</hi>: illi <foreign lang="greek">sumpo/sia</foreign>, nos convivia quod tum maxime simul vivitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem vis tum maxime cognita est cum ... M. Cato, legem suadens, in Galbam multa dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.129" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Just then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just at that moment</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">regi, tum maxime captivos ex Illyrico vendenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totam aciem vulgatum est, castra amissa esse, et tum cummaxime ardere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tum cummaxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus enim suum a caupone trucidatum tum maxime plaustro ad portam ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 10; 2, 10, 2; 3, 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:10" default="NO">6, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:61:31" default="NO">2, 61, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 53</bibl>.—So with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quod tum maxime Abydum oppugnaret cum rex ab Attalo et Rhodiis ultro se bello lacessitum diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.130" n="(g)" level="5"> Strengthening the co-ordinate tum after <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so especially;</hi> v. I. C. 3. e. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> (for cum maxime ... tum maxime and tum maxime ... cum plurimum, v. II. A. 3. a. b.).—</sense><sense id="n49390.131" n="5" level="3"> Tum potissimum = tum maxime, <hi rend="ital">just then</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar ... tum potissimum acie commissa impeditos religione hostes vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.132" n="6" level="3"> Etiam tum. </sense><sense id="n49390.133" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Even then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam tum vivit cum esse credas mortuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum se Servilio etiam tum tradidit,</quote> <trans><tr>even then</tr>, <tr>at so late a time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:62:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 62, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam tum cum verisimile erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 57</bibl></cit>.— So with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.134" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as yet</hi> (also as one word; cf. etiamtum, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> additional passages), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">And with a negation, = nondum: ipsa ego non longos etiam tum scissa capillos,</quote> <trans><tr>not yet long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.135" n="7" level="3"> Tum etiam. </sense><sense id="n49390.136" n="(a)" level="5"> Followed by si or cum, <hi rend="ital">even if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even when</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque equidem filium Tum etiam si nolit, cogam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tum etiam cum ... circumfusi erant caligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.137" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Then also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then too</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum etiam illud cogitatote, sic vivere Cornelium ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49390.138" n="8" level="3"> Tum quoque. </sense><sense id="n49390.139" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Also then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then as before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then as on another occasion</hi> mentioned before: ceu lapidem si Percutiat lapis aut ferrum; <cit><quote lang="la">nam tum quoque lumen Exsilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum quoque homini plus tribui quam nescio cui necessitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum quoque multis milibus Latinorum in civitatem acceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 369</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.140" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Even then</hi>, = etiam tum (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen tum quoque se absentes triumphare credunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 47, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17</bibl> (18), 190.—</sense><sense id="n49390.141" n="(g)" level="5"> In orat. obliq. (v. I. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">even now</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si Romani tum quoque aequa aspernarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49390.142" n="(d)" level="5"> = sic quoque, <hi rend="ital">even under the circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even as it was</hi>, etc. (v. sic, V. 3.): ut si effugium patuisset in publicum, impleturae urbem tumultu fuerint. Tum quoque<pb n="1912" /> <cb n="TUME" />  aliquotiens integro corpore evaserunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 4, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 13, 9: tum quoque, amputatā dextrā, navem sinistrā comprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.143" n="9" level="3"> Tum ipsum = eo ipso tempore, <hi rend="ital">at the very time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even then</hi> (only in Cic. in four passages; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ipsum): tota igitur ratio talium largitionum vitiosa est, temporibus necessaria, et tum ipsum ... moderanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quidem cum suā voluntate ex patriā Karthaginem revertisset, tum ipsum cum vigiliis et fame cruciaretur, clamat virtus beatiorem fuisse quam Thorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ipsum cum immolare velis extorum fieri mutatio potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita (oratores), non injuriā, quotienscunque dicerent, id quod aliquando posset accidere, ne tum ipsum accideret, timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:27:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 27, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.144" n="C" level="2"> Tum with co-ordinating particles. </sense><sense id="n49390.145" n="1" level="3"> Tum autem. </sense><sense id="n49390.146" n="(a)" level="5"> = praeterea, <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi> (v. I. C. 1.): turpilucricupidum te vocant cives tui; <cit><quote lang="la">tum autem sunt alii qui te volturium vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves scabrae sunt ... Tum autem Surorum nemo exstat qui ibi sex menses vixerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum autem qui non ipso honesto movemur ... callidi sumus, non boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:58:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.147" n="(b)" level="5"> = tum ... tum: <cit><quote lang="la">visne igitur inter hos populos inambulantes, tum autem residentes quaeramus eisdem de rebus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.148" n="(g)" level="5"> = eo tempore, with autem as connective: <cit><quote lang="la">tum illic autem Lemnius ... uxorem duxit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum autem ex omnibus montibus nives proluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.149" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">But in this instance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxori emunda ancilla'st: tum autem pluscula Supellectile opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 25</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n49390.150" n="2" level="3"> For tum etiam, v. B. 7. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.151" n="3" level="3"> Tum praeterea: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tui similis est probe. Tum praeterea talem, nisi tu, nulla pareret filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl> (v. I. C. 3. e. <foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n49390.152" n="4" level="3"> Tum porro: <cit><quote lang="la">tum porro venti magnam quoque tollere partem Umoris possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 623</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:829" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 829</bibl> (827).—</sense><sense id="n49390.153" n="D" level="2"> Quid tum? </sense><sense id="n49390.154" n="1" level="3"> In dialogue, <hi rend="ital">what then? what next? what further?</hi> novi ego hos pugnos meos. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Quid tum? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quid tum? Rogitas? Hisce ego, si tu me inritaveris, placidum te hodie reddam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 49</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 8</bibl>.—And strengthened: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tum postea?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 36</bibl>: videsne abundare me otio? <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Quid tum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49390.155" n="2" level="3"> In imitation of a dialogue: <cit><quote lang="la">at mulctantur bonis exsules. Quid tum? Parumne multa de tolerandā paupertate dicuntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 107</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 22, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:47:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dejot. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 230</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.156" n="3" level="3"> As emphatic co-ordinative in quoting the different items of a document, law, etc.: quive in senatu sententiam dixit, dixerit. Quid tum? Qui eorum coiit, coierit, etc., <hi rend="ital">what next?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listen!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49390.157" n="E" level="2"> Tum temporis = eo tempore (post class. and rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc temporis): posterā die civitas principem suum, ac tum temporis consulem in foro expectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
